La razón por la cual el señor B. busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es debido a que requiere de la compra de los materiales de trabajo para elaborar los calzados y sandalias para su respectiva venta. Es importante destacar que a lo inmediato de recibir el crédito comprará estos materiales para la elaboración de dichos calzados en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
The city of Masaya stands out for having very hard-working, dynamic people and such is the case with Mr. Manuel B. whose business is making and selling shoes. He has many years of experience both making and selling them in different areas of the city. B. is requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase materials to continue making shoes and sandals to be able to sell. It is important to highlight that immediately after receiving the loan, he will buy these raw materials in order to make the shoes and sell them in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Orfelina De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Orfelina de Jesús es una socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas” y vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, los cuales son visitantes del mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  verduras como papas, cebolla en sacos, tomate, ajíes, culantro, cebolla china, ajos y menestras para surtir su negocio y asegurar sus ventas. 

Orfelina tiene 62 años de edad, es madre de 06 hijos, todos independientes y vive con una de sus hijas quien la acompaña y la ayuda en sus momentos libres. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos, que permite crecer en el negocio, tanto a ella, como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orfelina de Jesus is a member of the Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) Village Bank and lives in the city of Moyabamba in San Martin, Peru. She sells vegetables from her store located in the city's central market where her customers seek her out daily. With this $425 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase vegetables such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, chilis, cilantro, Chinese onions, garlic, and beans to stock her business and assure her of future sales. Orfelina is 62 years old and the mother of 6 adult children. She lives with one of her daughters who accompanies her and helps her when she has free time. She is grateful for the help she will receive from Manuela Ramos which will help her to grow not only her business, but the businesses of the other women in her lending group.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, onions, tomatoes, chilis, Chinese onions, cilantro, garlic, beans, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS VIOLETAS”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Nueva Cajamarca. Se dedica a la venta de dulces como roscas dulces, kekes, suspiros, biscochos. Esta actividad lo desarrolla en la esquina del mercado, ya que es una avenida muy concurrida.  

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, lo cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diariamente dulces como, kekes, tortas, roscas, piononos, alfajores, suspiros, y otros tipos de dulces, también comprará bebidas como gaseosas de distintos sabores, tamaños y  marcas  y así satisfacer la gran demanda de sus clientes.  

La señora Santos  tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, es separada y vive con sus 2 últimos hijos quienes son la razón de su lucha constante. Su meta es surtir su puesto de venta que acaba de comprar en uno de los mercados de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos belongs to the Las Violetas (The Violets) Village Bank and lives in the City of Rioja in Nueva Cajamarca, San Martin, Peru. She sells sweets such as sweet baked ring cakes, cakes, and sweet breads. She sells on the corner of the market since it is a high-traffic area. With this $650 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase sweets such as cupcakes, cakes, ring cakes, Swiss rolls, and other types of sweets; she will also buy beverages like different flavors, sizes and brands of soft drinks in order to meet the demands of her customers. Mrs. Santos is 40 years old and the mother of 6 children. She is separated from her spouse and lives with her youngest two children who inspire her to keep working. Her goal is to stock her shop that she recently purchased in one of the city markets.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cupcakes, cakes, ring cakes, Swiss rolls, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Socorro Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Socorro, socia del BC “Las Estrellas de Jorge Chávez II”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de  chupetes, gelatinas y cosméticos. Vende de manera ambulatoria en los colegios y lugares donde se realizan eventos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes como azúcar, bolsitas para chupetes, vasos descartables para gelatina y frutas para la elaboración de los chupetes, además invertirá en ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Desea aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año para aumentar sus ventas.

Socorro tiene 31 años de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos y con su esposo, quien la apoya en lo que ella se propone. Es una persona amable y trabajadora. Su meta es arreglar su casa para implementar más y mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Socorro, member of the Las Estrellas de Jorge Chavez II (Jorge Chavez' Stars II) Village Bank lives in the city of Tarapoto in San Martin, Peru. She sells popsicles, gelatin, and cosmetics while walking through local schools and during local events. With this $250 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy ingredients to make her popsicles like sugar and small bags, paper cups for gelatin, and fruit for the popsicles; she will also invest in clothing for men, women, and children. She would like to take advantage of the year-end festivals in order to increase her sales. Socorro is 31 years old and lives with her two children and her husband who supports her in her business. She is a very friendly and hard-working person. Her goal is to fix her house in order to set up and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, small bags for popsicles, paper cups for gelatin, and fruit; also the purchase of clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de el Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Egilba Ramírez Gómez s/n,- cdra 02 caserío san isidro. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas de los caseríos cercanos.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite, leche grande y pequeño en caja, detergente de diversas marcas, fideos, papel higiénico y sal en paquetes, también bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas sabores y tamaños, etc. Desea surtir bien su negocio para asegurar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. 

Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre de 07 hijos. Actualmente vive con su esposo porque todos sus hijos ya son independientes. Tiene como meta ampliar continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolith, member of the Corazon de Jesus (Heart of Jesus) Village Bank lives in the city of Dorado in San Jose de Sisa, San Martin, Peru. She sells groceries from her home located on Egilbe Ramirez Gomen Street in the small hamlet of San Isidro. Her customers are her neighbors and people from the nearby farms. With this $325 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, small and large milk boxes, various brands of detergent, noodles, toilet papers, salt packets, and different sizes and brands of soft drinks. She would like to keep her business well-stocked to assure her of future sales and to satisfy the needs of her customers. She is 61 years old and the mother of 7 children. She currently lives with her husband because all her children are now grown-up and independent. Her goal is to expand her business and keep it well-supplied.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, small and large milk boxes, detergent, noodles, toilet paper, salt packets, and soft drinks

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín,  provincia de el Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a  la venta de abarrotes y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Egilba Ramírez Gómez s/n,- cdra 03 caserío san isidro. Sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que viven en los caseríos más cercanos.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite, leche grande y pequeño en caja, fideos, papel higiénico, sal en paquetes, sillao, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, sardinas, para surtir bien su negocio, también quiere invertir en su chacra. 

Tiene 40  años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer muy entusiasta, perseverante e independiente y le gusta manejar su dinero. Tiene como meta ampliar y surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolith is a member of the Community Bank "Corazon de Jesus" (meaning, Heart of Jesus). She lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of El Dorado, in the District of San Jose de Sisa. She runs a convenience store and it is located in her home at Jr. Egilba R. Gomez s/n, -cdra 3 Caserio San Isidro. Her clients are her neighbours and people whose home is close by.

With this loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase rice, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, milk in large and small containers, pasta, bathroom tissue, sal paquets, soy suace, softdrinks of different types and sizes, and sardines, to stock her business. She also wants to invest in her cultivating field.

She is 40 years old, lives with her husband and her two children who still depend on her. She is a woman with great enthusiasim, perseverence, and independence, and she loves to manage her own money. Her goal is to expand and add more selection to her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, milk in large and small containers, pasta, bathroom tissue, sal paquets, soy suace, softdrinks of different types and sizes, and sardines.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Rositas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO " ROSITA" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MARÍA DEL ROSARIO. LAS SOCIAS SE DEDICAN PRINCIPALMENTE AL COMERCIO D. DIVERSOS PRODUCTOS COMO ABARROTES, PELUCHES, BEBIDAS, COSMÉTICOS, GOLOSINAS Y ALA CONFECCIÓN D. CHOMPAS D. LANA. EN GENERAL LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENE UN BUEN CONOCIMIENTO D. SUS NEGOCIOS Y POR LA UBICACIÓN QUE TIENEN NO PRESENTAN DIFICULTADES CON LA COMPETENCIA. EL CRÉDITO SERÁ EMPLEADO EN LA COMPRA D. MATERIAS  E INSUMOS PARA INCREMENTAR LA MERCADERÍA A LA VENTA. LOS SOCIOS(AS) ESTÁN CURSANDO SU SEGUNDO CICLO POR LO QUE CONOCEN DEL TRABAJO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS HABIENDO DEMOSTRADO MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD DURANTE SU PRIMER CICLO, DEBIDO PRINCIPALMENTE A LA SOLIDARIDAD D. LAS SOCIAS Y A LA EFICIENCIA D. LA PRESIDENTA QUE DEMOSTRÓ UNA ACTITUD DINÁMICA PARA REGULARIZAR LAS CUENTAS D. ALGUNAS SOCIAS QUE NO PUEDEN PAGAR A TIEMPO.
texts.en:
The group "Rosita" (meaning, Little Rose) is represented by Maria Del Rosario. The members primarily carry out sales of various products, such as: groceries, toys, drinks, cosmetics, snacks, and also make wool jackets. In general the members have a good business background and due to their good location they do not have any difficulties from competitors. The loan will be used to purchase products and ingredients to increase their sales. The members are currently on their second cycle and they have worked in member groups. They have shown great responsibility through their first cycle, primarily because individuals' dedication and because of the group president's efficiency. She showed a dynamic attituD. to maintain the accounts of some members that could not meet the payments on time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Edith Nereyda

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer joven de edad que trabaja para una agencia aduanal dentro y fuera del trabajo Edith a demostrado una gran honradez, responsabilidad y el ser muy trabajadora.
Ella esta solicitando este credito para la colocación de las protecciones de su casa y asi obtener mas seguridad para su hogar.
texts.en:
Edith is a young woman that works as a customs official. Within and outside of work Edith has demonstrated great honesty and responsibility and she proved to be a hard worker.

She is requesting a loan to implement safety measures in her home, to obtain greater security for her house.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement safety measures in her home.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando es padre de familia y le ha brindado a su hogar una gran seguridad y estabilidad demostrando que es muy responsable. El trabaja en un videoclub como empleado de confianza y esta solicitando este credito para colocar una losa de concreto de un cuarto que ya tiene terminado y asi darle a su familia mayor comodidad y un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is a family man and he has provided great security and stability to his household, demonstrating his great sense of responsibility. He works in a video club and he is requesting this loan to install a concrete floor to a room that has otherwise been finished, to provide his family with greater comfort and a better way of life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install the floor in a room.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco es padre de familia y junto con su esposa la señora Yuriria buscan darles a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida; ellos están solicitando este crédito para colocar una losa de concreto del cuarto que construyeron para darle ampliación a su casita.
texts.en:
Francisco is a family man and together with his wife, Yuriria, he seeks to provide his children with a better way of life. They are requesting a loan to install a concrete floor in a room, built as an addition to their small home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a concrete floor in a room.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente es una persona D. mediana edad, esta casado con L. señora Susana, los dos son personas muy responsables y trabajadores, ellos están solicitando este crédito para L. construcción D. un techo tipo cochera, para proteger su automóvil del granizo y D. L. lluvia.
texts.en:
Vicente is a middle-aged man, he is married with his wife, Susana, and they are both very responsible and hard working people. They are requesting a loan to build the roof over a car port, to protect their car from hail and rain.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install the roof over a car port.

loans.name: Julian Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julián  es una persona joven pero también padre de familia y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable dentro y fuera de su casa, su esposa la señora Leonor es quien lo apoya y juntos como familia unida están solicitando este crédito para realizar la construcción de la barda  dando mayor seguridad a su casa.
texts.en:
Julian is a young man but he is also a family man. He has shown himself to be a responsible person inside and out of the home. His wife, Leonor, is his support and together as a unified family they are requesting a loan to build a wall, thereby providing greater safety to their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around their home.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en:
Zacarias L., 39 years old, is single and is a beauty expert who started his salon in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Among 10 siblings, Zacarias is the 7th child. Coming from a big family, education for all of them was impossible, but despite this, he was not discouraged from pursuing his studies. His interest in cosmetology allowed him to support himself doing home services for his relatives, neighbors, professionals, government employees and even prominent people in their town.  He also has a small space for his parlor to accomodate walk-in customers.

Zacarias fell in love with the programs and services of Paglaum MPC.  The trainings, insurance, loan windows of the cooperative are what he likes most. He remains a member in good standing with his 6 loan. Recently, he applied for a PHP 7,000 loan to acquire additoinal beauty products and he aspires to have a bigger space for his loyal and potential customers.

He has supported his parents up to now, and he dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of his salon business.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stocks for his beauty salon

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa Dinndin, 34 years old and a resident of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, is busy tending her little sari-sari store. Being single, she devoted her life to her business as she grew up to have her own sales. She tried snack selling pancakes and "benignit" ( a porridge with coco milk). Her loyal customers are her relatives and neighbors. One day, she decided to start a mini grocery store with a small amount of capital. She is impressed with the returns.

Elisa is in her 4th year of membership to Paglaum MPC where she got working capital. She feels fulfilled that through her little sari-sari store, she is able to help the community. She plans to expand her business by venturing into rice trading and animal feed.

Elisa hopes that one day she'll become a big-time wholesaler of rice and feed, a commitment not only to herself but to the community.

loans.use: Capital for rice trading and animal feeds

location.town: San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora C., married with 3 children, resides at Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. Her husband is a "baranggay" (village) captain, who is also her greatest help with their sari-sari (variety) store. Life is good for the family. Her children were never deprived of a good education. What challenges the couple most is their 3rd child who has a congenital disease. Medication maintenance is always a consideration. The store sales must sustain their needs.

Nora also values her 8-year membership with the PMPC. She says that the cooperative is readily available for capital needs. She has applied for a PHP 50,000 loan to invest more in their store, especially for rice trading.   

She dreams of being a rice wholesaler in their area, but more than that, she wants to support all the medication needs of her child.

loans.use: To have additional capital for rice trading

loans.name: Mame Fatim

texts.fr: K. Mame Fatim, mariée et mère de 03 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce d’arachide et du sucre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
K. Mame Fatim is married and the mother of three children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her commerce in peanuts and sugar. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Aminata Nifiba

texts.fr: Aminata Nifiba L., veuve et mère de 04 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de ventes de tissu, tissu teinté et de chaussures. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aminata Nifiba L., a widow and mother of four children to look after, has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business selling cloth, dyed fabrics, and shoes. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve her famiL.'s living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth and shoes

loans.name: Ami Collé

texts.fr: Ami Collé S., mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce de condiments (poissons séchés, yet, piment, balai, patates et autres. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami Collé S., married and having five children to look after, has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to boost her commerce in goods, such as smoked fish, 'yet' (a kind of dried mollusk), chili peppers, brooms, potatoes, and more. Her income enables her to cover family expenses and to improve living conditions at home. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish, dried mollusks, chili peppers...

loans.name: Diéba

texts.fr: Diéba D., mariée et mère de 06 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de ventes de tissus teintés (imprimé et en couleur unique). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Married and having six children to look after, Diéba D. has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business selling dyed fabrics (printed or monochromatic). The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in dyed fabrics

loans.name: Julia Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Julia Rafaela T. G. ella es del Departamento de Totonicapan con residencia en final de la zona 4 Totonicapan doña Julia se dedica  a bordado manual desde cuando era niña dicha actividad lo fue aprendiendo con sus abuelitos hace diez años decidio aperturar un su pequeño taller, con dos trabajadoras que era sus primas, poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio, con el material que ella utiliza son muy caros en el mercado si lo compra por unidad, ella con la intencio de superar necesita de un credito lo cual lo solicita en las Oficinas de la Sucursal de Asdir Totonicapan con el fin de mejorar su producto con varios colores.
texts.en:
Julia Rafaela T. G. is from Totonicapan and lives in the end area of 4 Totonicapan. Julia has been doing needlepoint since she was a girl, a skill she learned from her grandparents. Ten years ago she decided to set up a small shop with two workers, who are her cousins. Slowly but surely the business started to grow. The materials she uses are very expensive in the markets when she purchases small amounts. With the intention of improving she is requesting a loan from Oficinas de la Sucursal de Asdir Totonicapan (Kiva Field Partner). She wishes to improve her products by using many colors.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana M. se ha dedicado desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de alimentos específicamente a la venta de carne de cerdo el cual la comercializa en su casa de habitación en su comunidad.

Por medio de este negocio la señora M. puede mantener su hogar compuesto por sus tres hijos de los cuales uno de ellos estudia en un pequeño colegio de la comunidad. El propósito por el cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de un cerdo para proceder al destace y vender la carne y a la vez para preparar los alimentos para la venta. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Within the Municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Ana M. has spent the past 5 years selling foods, specializing in pork meats sold from her home to the community.

Through her business, Mrs. M. can maintain her household, made up of her three children. One of them is currently studying in a small school in the community. The reason she sought support from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is to obtain a loan to buy a pig to slaughter and sell the meat, and prepare foods for sale. She hopes her loan will be well completed.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Juana Licelda

texts.es:
Juana Licelda es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería que ha nacido por sus grandes sacrificios que ha hecho para subsistir. La pulpería tiene actualmente 17 años y hoy en día ella se ha preocupado por desarrollarla y es por esto que ha decido invertir en ella.

Para ver logrado su sueño de ver mejorada su pulpería ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para comercializarlos. Por este motivo espera que su solicitud crediticia sea aprobada y de esta forma continuar esforzándose por mejorar su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Juana Licelda is the owner of a small convenience store that came about from great sacrifices she has made to support herself. The convience store is now 17 years old and currently she plans to develop it further, which is why she has decided to invest in it.

To see her dream of an improved convenience store come true, she has come to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan that will permit her to purchase products for resale. With this goal she hopes that this loan will be aproved and, in this manner, keep struggling to improve her convenience store, located in her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sweets and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en:
M. Rahim is 20 years old he lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is responsible for his family because his father died during the war in Kabul 10 years ago. He just finished school and started working. He worked in the Ministry of Education in Kabul as a computer worker. He lives with his family in a rented house but he has some land. 

He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to complete his stock and start working to build his house has soon as possible. It is one of his best wishes to do in the future.

M. Rahim wants to thank both Kiva and AFSG for this successful loan process  in this country.

loans.use: To buy material and build a house

loans.name: Sadiqa

texts.en:
Sadiqa who is very talented and a hard worker. She works in a beauty parlor and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Before this she worked in Pakistan, but after the collapse of the Taliban, she came back and started working in Kabul. This talented woman said, "When I found out about this loan process, I was really happy and I completed all the documents and want to take a loan."

Now she has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans in the term of 18 months to complete some of necessary materials to further her working and have more success and help her family better.

Sadiqa wants to say, "I am very happy to see this process grow in Afghanistan because every worker can use it and can further their business using this loan process. She wants to thank all the lenders who support this process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete some of necessary materials

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita A. is 44 years of age and resides at Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children, 2 in high scool and 1 in elementary school. Fishing and fish selling is their prime source of income. They bring their catch to markets, to the neighborhood and sometimes walk to the different establishments just to make sure of an income. Adelita works hard for the family. She also does laundry for friends and sometimes for prominent households. Meeting the daily challenges in life is hard to survive. But to the A. family, these can't pull them down. Recently Adelita applied for PHP 20,000 loan for purchase of additional fishing nets and hopefully to acquire a lot to start a home of their own. The 7 loans she made to Paglaum MPC were promptly paid. She said that Paglaum helped a lot in uplifting their lives.

She dreams of sending her children to college. She smiled that her loyalty will remain with Paglaum MPC forever.

loans.use: Purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
A widowed dressmaker with 2 children, Anita P. lives simply at Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She admits that life is totally different being father and mother at the same time. Supporting her family at the age of 62, she maintains the high quality of her dressmaking business from PHP 3,000 start-up capital. She often does school and office uniforms where job orders are in volume.

Anita is on her 7th year of membership in Paglaum MPC. All these years, Paglaum has been a consistent financing partner. The capitalization of 2 sewing machines was made easy. Today, Anita wants to try curtains and appliance and throw pillow covers. But this new venture will require capital for the materials, so she has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan.

Anita would like to employ one dressmaker for her business and she hopes to save money for her old age. But more than anything else, she fervently pray for a united, happy and healthy family.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase textiles for her tailoring business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
In Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Marilyn L. is running a good pottery business. She is married with 4 children; 3 are already working and one is still in college. Marilyn has never focused only on pottery; she wants to try another business for additional income. She is considering a fishing business. Aside from fishing, she has embraced the idea of fishnet making and buying and selling "lahoy" (shark). She believes these businesses will supplement her living.

Just like pottery, the other businesses are also fragile. They are so delicate that Marilyn makes it a point to handle them with much care. One wrong move will surely bring the business down. But she is thankful to Paglaum MPC for helping her out, not only with capital but also with training in micro-entrepreneurship. This PHP 20,000 she has applied for will be used for the repair of their sailboat and purchase of additional fishing accessories.

She hopes to help the community by employing someone to help them with fishing. She makes a priority of saving for old age and she desires for her businesses to grow and flourish.

loans.use: For sailboat repair and purchase of additional fishing accessories

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar T. owns a "sari-sari" (little general store) in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years of age, married to Shandy, and gifted with 3 adorable children. Shandy is working but Maricar is helping the family out with her little store and a sideline of selling meat and poultry products. The store is continuously doing well with their neighbors as their potential market.

As Paglaum MPC is reaching out to its members to have micro-entrepreneurship training, Maricar is truly benefited. With the constant reminders of the cooperative, she is disciplined to pay her 10 loan cycles on time. The PHP 20,000 she has requested is guaranteed never to be defaulted.

Maricar dreams of growing her little "sari-sari" into a real grocery store. She also hopes to have her children get a good education. But she prays most of all that their business will last.

loans.use: To purchase additional bottled and canned goods for her "sari-sari"

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 6 hijos  que aun estudian, es casada, su esposo trabaja en el Valle de Ite donde siembra ají para luego venderlo, negocio al que ambos se dedican. Con el primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela R. de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compro un chanchito para engorde y luego venderlo para pagar su préstamo. Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, ella se dedica a la compra y  venta de ají que compra en Desaguadero y que vende en Moquegua.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 5 cuotas comprara un quintal de ají.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia belongs to "Banco Comunal "Espíritu Santo" of the Centro Poblado de Chimbo, District and Pronvice of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 34 years old and the mother of 6 school-going children, she is married and her husband works in the Valle de Ite where he grows chili. Both later sell the chili for a living. With the first loan from Manuela R. of S/.500.00 nuevos soles, she bought a small pig to be fattened and then sold in order to repay the loan. She has been working with the "Banco" for 1 year.

Presently she buys chili in Desaguadero and sells it in Moquegua. With the loan of S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 5 payments she will buy a "quintal" of chili.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chili in bulk.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. Desaguadero S/N. Tiene 45 años, es casada y madre de 3 hijos que dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  compro mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes  que funciona  frente a la Plaza de Armas de Juli. Tiene casi 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

Leonor con el fin de tener más ganancias también hace bordados en bayeta y continúa vendiendo en su pequeña tienda.

Con este préstamo de S/: 400.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara gaseosas, galletas, pollo, etc.

Su sueño es irse de Juli y comprarse su casa en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonor is a member of "Banco Comunal "Inmaculada Concepción" of the district of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Puno, She lives in Jr. Desaguadero S/N. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children that depend on her. With the first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles she bought merchandise for her grocery store which is located in front of Plaza de Armas in Juli, She has been working with the bank for 1 year.

In order to obtain more income Leonor also embroiders on cloth and continues selling at her small store. With this loan of S/.400.00 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy soft drinks, cookies, chicken etc. It is her dream to leave Juli and buy her house somewhere else.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Mrs. Yann N., a 48-year-old rice farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province, is the mother of five children; one is married and another is a waitress at a guesthouse. Her husband, Mr. Souv Kong, 44, has been a rice farmer since 1979.

To earn additional income, Yann is applying for a loan of $250 to purchase piglets to raise in her home. The increased family income resulting from this loan will help them sustain their financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mat S., 30, is married and resides with her two young children and her husband in Battambong, Cambodia. She is a housewife who stays at home doing housework and cooking food for her family. Her husband runs a motor-taxi to earn a living and is able to make US$ 3.50 in profit a day. Both their children are students. Every month, Mat S. spends around US$ 40 on food, US$ 4 on utilities and US$ 10 on her children’s education.

To make more money, Mat S. has requested a loan of US$ 600 to open a grocery stand. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To open a little grocery store.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay C., 51, is married and lives with his six children in the Battambong province. He is a motor-taxi driver who works for less than $5 each day. His wife works selling rice and foods and bean juice at the market, making $7 day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chhay C. included. In light of these economic difficulties, Chhay is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport goods to sell at the market. This will reduce the public transportation's cost.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: They

texts.en: Mrs. They C. lives in Krodas Kor Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a 57-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are farmers while two are fishermen and the remaining one is attending the local school. She is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crop so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: They Chay would like to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun S., a 39-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province and the mother of five children who are all in school, grows rice and vegetables to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Bunny Chouk, 25, is a house decorator who also rents out decorations and musical instruments for wedding parties and other occasions.

Because he needs to improve his business but lacks the capital to do so, Soeun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more loudspeakers and fans for his service. (Mrs. Soeun's husband is pictured because she was not available)

loans.use: To buy more loudspeakers and fans.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai N. was born in 1954 and she lives in Krodas Kor Village in Kampong Cham Province. Hai has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a translator and the youngest one is attending the local school. She is a farmer who has 2 hectares to cultivate rice to earn her living. In this plantation, she now has an obstacle because of infertile soil. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sein Sim, helps her on the plantation, and he is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Hai would like to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long N., 48, is married and lives with her husband and five children in  Battambong province, Cambodia. She is a local teacher and makes $3 a day, while her husband stays at home growing many kinds of mint. On average, he is able to make $4 a day. Three of their children are students and two are helping him with planting mint. 

Long N. is asking a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizers. (Husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Four people who all live in Pou Thum Village in Kandal Province make up this group loan. Mr. P. Pao is the group leader and he is a television repair man in the local village. In this business he now faces a problem because he does not have enough television part supplies for his consumers. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy them for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. Suy Saruon, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. P. is 45 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while two are attending the local school and the youngest is only five years old.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. One member has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Pat would like to buy television part supplies for his customers and the others would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of 24 people, is located in Akrrei Ksat Village in Kandal Province and Mr. Mom S. is village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables for a living. Since this vegetable farming field has infertile soil, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Sok Khon, helps him on the plantation. Mom and Sok have three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Ten members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Mom would like to buy fertilizers to make his crop more productive and the others would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mrs. Ra P. is a villager in Ang Konh Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small rice field to cultivate rice to earn a living. In the cultivation, she usually gathers the revenue every January. Her husband, Mr. Lam Pov, helps her in the plantation. They have five children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Although they have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Ra decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver. She hopes to increase their income with this loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Ra would like to buy a new motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Mrs. Yom N. is a 50-year-old who makes a living raising ducks for sale from her home in Bosbeng Village in Kompong Tom Province. She has five children, two of whom are married, while one son is a construction worker, and three are factory workers. Her husband, Mr. Yong Chress, 59, breeds cows to sell.

Yom is requesting a loan of $500 to buy more food for her ducks to eat. The increased income resulting from this loan will allow her to meet her family's living expenses.

(Mrs. Yom and her granddaughter are pictured)

loans.use: To buy more duck food.

loans.name: Muoy Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Muoy Ly O. was born in 1976 and she lives in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province. Muoy is 32 years old, the mother of three children who are all attending the local school, and she breeds pigs. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her business. Her husband, Mr. Tel Orn, is a traditional medical seller who can make a small income to support the family. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Muoy would like to buy more piglets to breed for her business.

loans.name: Yann

texts.en: Mrs. Yann M. is a villager in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province and she is a farmer. Yann is 29 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is only two years old. In her plantation, she usually gathers rice revenue every January. Her husband, Mr. Tem Oeun, is a traditional medicine seller who can generate a small income to support the household, and he is shown on the right of photo. Although Yann and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot improve their living conditions. Thus, Yann decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cows.

loans.use: Yann would like to buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Mrs. Teng Y. lives in Prey Takhab Village in Takeo Province. She is a 55-year-old widow with three children who are all employed in a garment factory. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Although Teng and her children have multiple businesses, they still cannot afford to buy tile and cement to make a tile floor for her house. She hopes to provide her household with better conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Teng would like to buy tile and cement to make a tile floor for her house.

loans.name: Mech

texts.en: Mrs. Mech M. was born in 1966 and she lives in Ang Konh Village Takeo Province. Mech is 42 years old and the mother of three children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Mao Phal, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the household, and he is presented on the right in the photo. Since his work place is far from their house and he usually spends a lot of money on transportation, Mech decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.use: Mech would like to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy N. is a villager in Pong Toek Village, Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Mon Neng, helps her on the plantation. They have three children who all attend the local school. Although Chanthy and her husband have two different businesses, they still cannot provide better conditions for their family. In order to improve their standard of living, Chanthy decided to ask for a loan to buy steel to build a house and she hopes to make her household in better condition to live in. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: Chanthy would like to buy steel to build her family's house.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn N., 36, of Treal Commune in Kompong Tom Province, raises pigs, sells groceries, and provides the services of his rice mill machine to local customers. His wife, Mrs. Sham Oun, 36, who takes care of their three children, all attending school, also sells groceries and raises pigs in her home.

Oeurn is requesting a $400 loan to purchase a rice mill machine to replace his old one and to buy more groceries for sale. (Oeurn's wife is pictured because he was not available for the photo.)

loans.use: To purchase a rice mill machine

loans.name: Sok Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Ly N. was born in 1971 and she lives in Ang Konh Village in Takeo Province. Sok is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school. She is a pig breeder, and since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy two more pigs for breeding and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Muth Khan, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: Sok would like to buy two more pigs for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mrs. Pho P. is a villager in Veild village in Kampong Cham Province. Pho is 35 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. She is a pig breeder, and since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs and pig food for her pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Chhoeurn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: Pho would like to buy more pigs and pig food for her pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
A resident of Baray Commune in Kompong Tom Province, Mrs. Tha P., the 41-year-old mother of four children, (one a garment worker in Phnom Penh City), raises pigs to sell. Involved in this business since 1995. Tha reports that her business is doing well, and that her $120 per month income helps to sustain her family as it is coupled with the salary of her husband, 43-year-old truck driver Mr. Pom Nou.

Tha is now requesting a loan of $300 both to purchase more piglets to raise and to decorate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mr. Mao K. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. He is 53 years old and the father of six children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. He and his wife, Mrs. Huon Chheang, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. His wife is shown on the left in the photo. In this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile which has a bad effect on their crop. In order to deal this problem, Mao decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his field to make his crop more productive.

loans.use: Mao would like to buy fertilizer to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Mul

texts.en: Mrs. Mul M. is 40 years old and lives in Ta Ny village in Kampong Cham Province and is a housewife. She is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, two others attend the local school and the rest are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Soer Tho, cultivates vegetables and he is shown on the right of the photo. He now wants to grow cassavas but he does not have enough money to plant it. Thus, Mul decided to ask for a loan to cultivate cassavas. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Mul would like to cultivate cassavas.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. Nueva Victoria Nº 143, estudio el tercer grado de secundaria.
Tiene 42 años  y es madre de 6 hijos que están estudiando, es casada, su esposo le ayuda en su negocio de venta de comida. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro insumos para seguir preparando viandas (comida). Tiene casi 7 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad sigue con esta actividad económica  que le genera ingresos para cumplir con sus pagos regularmente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 meses comprara arroz, azúcar, fideos, carne y otros.

 “Es una buena ayuda para las mujeres que no tenemos facilidades para obtener un préstamo” manifiesta muy agradecida  Lourdes

Su  gran deseo es salir adelante para irse de Juli y abrir un Restaurante en Puno.
texts.en:
Mrs. María belongs to "Banco Comunal "Inmaculada Concepción" of the district of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Puno. She lives in Jr. Nueva Victoria No. 143, and studied third grade, secondary. She is 42 years old and the mother of 6 school-going children, she is married and her husband helps at her business selling food. With the first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles, she bought raw material in order to continue the food production. She has been working with the bank for almost 7 years.

Presently this economic activity is generating earnings so she can fulfill her payments regularly. With this loan of S/.2000.00 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, meat and others.

"This is a good support for the women that don't have facilities to obtain a loan", says a grateful María Lourdes. It is her wish to be successful so she can move from Juli and open a restaurant in Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material: rice, noodles, sugar, meat, etc.

loans.name: Sas

texts.en: Mrs. Sas L. is a 55 year-old widow who lives in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. She faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sas L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field to make her crop more productive. She is the mother of a child who is a fisherman.

loans.use: Sas would like to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel  es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del  Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 3 hijos que están a su cuidado, estudio el tercer grado de primaria, es casada, su esposo se ocupa de otras labores  y le ayuda a trabajar para poder cumplir con el pago correspondiente. Maribel con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro un chancho para engorde y luego poder venderlo.

Actualmente  continua con la crianza de animales menores y  realiza labores agrícolas para su sustento. Ella hace un año es integrante del Banco Comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, aumentara su capital y comprara 01 ganado vacuno a S/. 2,000.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casa fuera de su pueblo y así iniciar con otro negocio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit), located in Centro Poblado de Chimbo, in the District and Province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 35 years old and she is mother of 3 children who are still under her care. She has a grade 3 education, she is married, and her husband works as a laborer and works to help her make her payments. Maribel, with the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of S/.300 nuevos soles, purhcased a pig to fatten and later sell.

Currently she still raises small livestock and works in agriculture to make a living. She has been a member of the Community Bank for one year.

With this loan of S/.1500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will supplement her capital and purchase 1 head of cattle at S/.2000.

Her greatest dream is to be able to purchase a huose outside of her town and start another business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito- Puno, vive en el Jr. Asunción Nº 108, Tiene 37 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos que dependen de ella, culmino sus estudios superiores y tiene  una bodega  en la Plaza de Armas de Juli, donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, etc.
Ella empezó a trabajar haciendo todo tipo de negocios desde los 27 años, al inicio con el préstamo de S/. 300.00  nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro mas mercadería para su tienda.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles el que pagara en 4 meses, comprara: azúcar, arroz, leche, panteones, galletas, etc.

Marleny manifiesta que:” los créditos que brinda Manuela Ramos ayudan mucho y dan oportunidad para seguir trabajando”.

Su gran deseo es tener una pequeña empresa y abrir otras tiendas.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the Community Bank "Inmaculada Concepcion" (meaning, Immaculate Conception) located in the district of Juli, within the province of Chucuito-Puno. She lives in Jr. Asuncion No.108. She is 37 years old, is married and has two children that are still dependents. She completed her schooling and runs a convience store in La Plaza de Armas de Juli, where she sells groceries, softdrinks etc. She started working by taking on all kinds of businesses from the age of 27. At first she started out with a loan of S/.300 nuevos soles, increasing her capital and purchasing more merchandise for her store.

With this loan of S/.3000 neuvos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase: sugar, rice, milk, decorations, cookies, etc.

Marleny says that "the loans provided by Manuela Ramos [Kiva Field Partner] help a great deal and grant her the opportunity to keep on working."

Her greatest dreamis to have a small company and open more stores.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, pasta, decorations etc.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly C., 47 years old, has four children, two of whom are day laborers, while the other two attend a local school. Her husband, Mr. Naov Ra, too, works as a laborer. Mrs. Ly C. lives in the Kampong Cham Province, earning income as a farmer. She cultivates rice on the 1 hectare of land that she owns. However, the earnings are inadequate for ensuring a decent standard of living for her family, partly because the field is far from an irrigation system. To increase her income, Mrs. Ly C. would like to cultivate rice also during the dry season. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to be able to purchase a pump to water the rice field.

loans.use: Purchase of a pump to water a rice field

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat M., 29, the mother of three young children, all in school, raises pigs and distills Khmer wine in her home in Srolav Commune, Kompong Tom Province. Currently earning approximately $4 each day, Sinat is married to Mr. Neang Noeun, age 33, a motorcycle and horse cart taxi driver making about $5 per day.

In order to increase family income, Sinat is applying for a $1,000 loan to buy rice to store for later sale and to purchase two oxen.

loans.use: To buy rice to store for later sale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo”  desD. hace 8 años, que esta ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno.
Tiene 50 años D. edad y es madre D. 8 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 dependen D. ella y continúan estudiando, es casada, su esposo trabaja en construcción. Ella estudio el sexto grado D. Primaria. Lucia con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la compra D. animales menores como chanchos, ovejas y vacas para engorD..

Actualmente continua con el negocio D. crianza D. animales  que venD. en la Feria D. Acora y Chacachaca, contando siempre con el  apoyo D. su esposo y así pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas  comprara 01 ganado vacuno para engorD..
La señora Lucia manifiesta que los préstamos que da Manuela Ramos son un apoyo para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia has been a member of the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit) for the past 8 years. It is located at Centro Pobaldo D. Chimbo within the District and Province of Yunguyo-Puno.

She is 50 years old and she is mother of 8 children, 2 of whom are still dependent on her and are still in school. She is married and her husband is a construction worker. She has a graD. 6 education. With the first loan Lucia received of S/.300 she decided to invest the funds in the purchase of small livestock such as pigs, lambs and calves.

She is currently still with the same business raising livestock, selling them in the fairs of Acora and Chacachaca. She can always count on the support of her husband and therefore always manage to make her loan payments on time.

With this loan of S/.2000 nuevos sles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will purchase 1 head of cattle.

Lucia says that the loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is a great support for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one head of cattle.

loans.name: Theth

texts.en: Mr. Theth H., 29, is married and has two children, both of whom attend a local school. He lives in the Boeung Veng village in Kampong Cham Province, earning income as a rice farmer together with his wife, Mrs. Soern Sort. The rice plantation currently does not provide sufficient earnings, since the fertility of the soil is low. Mr. Theth H. is therefore asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field, thus hoping to increase the family's income and improve its living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” ubicado en el centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 45 años, es madre de 6 hijos que están trabajando en Lima., es casada, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  compro 02 chanchitos. Hace 02 años que trabaja con Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad continúa dedicándose a la crianza de ganado lo que le  permite pagar sin retraso su cuota mensual.
 
Con este crédito de S/.  1,500.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas  aumentara su capital y comprara 01 ganado vacuno (vaca) para engorde.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit), located in Centro Poblado de Chimbo in the District and Municipality of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 45 years old and she is mother of 6 children, all working in Lima. She is married and her husband works with her raising a cattle and pigs. With the first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she purchased 2 piglets. It has been 2 years since she has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner).

Currently she continues to raise cattle and it permits her to always make her monthly payments.

With this loan of S/.1500 neuvos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will supplement her capital and purchase 1 head of cattle.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 1 head of cattle.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Vicente pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno desD. hace 8 años. Es casada y madre D. 05 hijos, 4 D. ellos casados y que viven en Lima y 1 que aun estudia y depenD. D. ella. Tiene 50 años D. edad. Con el primer préstamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos  soles  compro animales D. carga “burros”.

En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno para engorD., su esposo es el que lleva los animales para vender en la Feria D. Acora o Ilave, con la ganancia D. estas ventas paga puntualmente al Banco.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas, comprara 01 ganado vacuno a S/. 2.800.

Su mayor deseo es comprarse una maquina para confeccionar ropa e ir a trabajar a Lima junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vicente has belonged to the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit), located in Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, within the District and Province of Yunguyo-Puno, for the past 8 years. She is married and is mother of 5 children, 4 of whom are married and live in Lima. One of them is currently studying and still depends on her. She is 50 years odl. With the first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she purchased working animals, donkeys.

Currently she raises cattle, and her husband takes the livestock for sale in the fairs of Feria D. Acora or llave. With the profit she always manages to make her payments to the Community Bank on time.

With this loan of S/.3000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will purchase 1 head of cattle at S/.2800.

Her greatest dream is to purchase a sewing machine and to move to Lima to work alongsiD. her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de 1 ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Nau

texts.en: Mrs. Nau C. is 29 years old and has three children, all of whom attend a local school. Her husband, Mr. Yan Pao, works as a motorbike repairer. Mrs. Nau C. lives in the Veild village in Kampong Cham Province, earning a living cultivating rice on a plot of land that she owns. Additionally, she also breeds pigs. At present, Mrs. Nau C. needs a loan to purchase additional pig feed to increase her business revenue.

loans.use: Purchase of pig feed

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha C., 34, has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others attend a local school. Her husband, Mr. Yein Yang, is a construction worker. The family lives in the Pnaov Lech village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Sokha C. earns income breeding pigs. Her business is going well, and she would like to expand it. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to be able to buy additional piglets and pig feed. She hopes that the business expansion will increase her income, allowing to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann L., 25 years old, has 4 children, two of whom attend school, while the other two are still little. Sarann L. lives in the Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham Province, earning income as a farmer, while her husband, Mr. Chheng Chhen, is a fisherman. Sarann L. owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. To improve the productivity of her farming business, she currently needs a loan to be able to buy rice seeds and fertilizers and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, rice seeds, and hire of laborers

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mr. Min M., 45, has two children, one of whom is attends a local school, while the other one is still too young to work or study. Min M. lives in the village of Knol Dambang in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Phang Reth, are farmers who cultivate rice on a piece of land that they own. Unfortunately, the plot is located far from an irrigation system, and Min M. needs a loan to be able to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and petrol to improve the productivity of his farming business.

loans.use: Purchase of rice seeds, fertilizers, and petrol for a rice farming business

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en: Mrs. Sochea E., 45, has five children, one of whom is a beautician, another two are farmers, while the youngest two are enrolled in a local school. Mrs. Sochea E. and her husband, Mr. Thouch Mom, are farmers who cultivate rice on a plot of land that they own in the Tung Tong village in Kampong Cham Province. Unfortunately, the farming business does not provide sufficient income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Sochea E. is asking for a loan to help her daughter open a beauty salon in the local market. She hopes that the new business will increase the family's income and improve its living conditions.

loans.use: Opening of a beauty salon

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann T. is 51 years old, married, and has a child who is currently attending a local school. Mrs. Vann T. lives in the Krodas Khor village in Kampong Cham Province. She earns income breeding chicken, while her husband, Mr. Chhet Lock, cultivates rice on a piece of land that the couple owns. The rice field, however, is not sufficiently productive, and Mrs. Vann T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the fertility of the soil.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to improve the productivity of a rice farming business

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang C., 32, has two children, both of whom attend a local school. Mrs. Heang C. lives in the Veild village in Kampong Cham Province and earns income breeding pigs. Her husband, Mr. Try Trin, is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land that the family owns. The plantation, however, is not very productive, as it is far from an irrigation system. To improve the fertility of the soil of the rice field, Mrs. Heang C. needs a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers and petrol for pumping.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and petrol for a farming business

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en: Mrs. Yeth P., 49, has three children, one of whom is a palm juice collector, another one earns income plowing fields for other farmers, while the third one still attends school. Mrs. Yeth P. lives in the village of Krodas Khor in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ean Eng, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. They currently need a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the productivity of the plantation.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Someurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Someurn T., of Kompong Tom Province, is a 40-year old mother of four children, three employed and one attending school, who makes a living selling grocery items such as sugar, seasonings, onions, and cakes for kids from her home. She can earn approximately $4 per day while her 38-year-old husband, Mr. Chorn Sang, works outside the home.

Someurn is now requesting a loan of $625 to purchase more groceries to sell and to build a small store for making sales easier. Someurn's husband is pictured because she was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rorn S., a 40-year-old resident of Chrolorng Commune in Kopong Tom Province, raises ducks in order to sell their eggs, often collecting over 100 eggs per day. This mother of three school-aged children is married to Mr. Khoun Som, 44, who breeds cows for a living.

Rorn is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more food for her ducks. The increased revenue resulting from this loan will help her to meet her family's expenses and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her ducks.

loans.name: Chandara

texts.en:
Chandara L., is 27, single and lives with his widow mother, brother, and cousin. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.
Chandara has been an invitation letter publisher (wedding, ceremony, etc.) for two years. He bought publishing materials from Toul Tumpong market so he could work at home. He hopes in the future he will be able to build his own printing shop .
Chandara is requesting a loan of 500 to purchase a motorbike for his family.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for using in the family.

loans.name: Helena Pedro

texts.pt:
Helena Pedro M. é natural do distrito de Chibuto, província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 5Filhos com idades o primeiro com 32 anos e trabalha, o segundo com 28 anos estuda na 8ªclasse e trabalha, terceiro com 24 anos e estuda na 10ªclasse, quarto com 16 anos e estuda na 8ªclasse, quinto com 4 anos de idade e ainda não estuda. 

Helena estudou até 2ªclasse e parou por falta de condições e problemas sociais que consistira na separação dos seus pais. Passou a sua infância até ao casamento na província de Gaza e mudou se para cidade de Maputo na companhia do marido que trabalhava na cidade. Vive numa casa própria.

Helena vive de negocio que consiste na venda de cereais num dos grandes mercados da cidade de Maputo. Faz este negocio a mais de 20 anos, onde destaca o milho que adquira o saco por 850,00mt e vende por 1000,00mt e consegue um rendimento liquido mensal de 3500,00mt.

Helena tem planos de pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim construir algumas dependências para aluguer afim de aumentar a sua renda familiar.
texts.en:
Helena Pedro M. was born in Chibuto, a southern province of Gaza, in Mozambique. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of five children ages 4-32, three of which are in school. Helena's own studies were interrupted after 2nd Grade due to her parents' divorce and their subsequent financial difficulties. She currently lives in Maputo with her husband and kids, at a house they own. For the past 20 years Helena has been in the business of selling dry cereal in one of Maputo's main markets. Her main product is currently corn, which she buys bulk for 850,00 and sells for 1000,00 mt. Her overall monthly profit is 3,500 mt, and Helena plans to pay this loan back quickly, so that she can take out another one, to build additional rooms that she can rent to help increase her income.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling dry cereals

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun S., 58, and his wife, Saly Port, 56, live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their sons has full time employment, the other son is a primary school teacher and the daughter iswas married and lives outside the family house.
Soeun has been a secondary school teacher for twenty-seven years. His wife sells cakes, candy, and fruit in the village school. She buys them from local market. Soeum is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase wood materials for repairing the wall in his house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials for repairing wall of his house.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann C., 59, is widowed and has three children, two of whom are palm juice collectors, while the third one is a farmer who helps his mother in farming rice. The family lives in the Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Vann C.'s rice plantation is not very productive due to the low fertility of the soil. She is therefore asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to be able to increase the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina L., 27, and her husband, Yun Yin, 31,  live in a small village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have two sons and they all live at home together.

Dina has been a garment factory worker for three years. Her husband has been a mason for seven years. The couple lacks the money to build a rest room to use in the family house. Therefore, Dina is requesting a loan of US$300 to build a rest room.

loans.use: To build one rest room to use in the family.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mr. Sreng S. is 30 years old, has two young children, and lives in the Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. He earns income cultivating rice on a piece of land that he owns, while his wife, Mrs. Koeun Chhen, breeds pigs. Mr. Sreng S.'s rice plantation is not very productive, as the fertility of the soil is low. He has therefore decided to ask for a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers and thereby improve the productivity of his farming business.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Sithach

texts.en:
Sithach Y., 39, is a widow with three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are garment factory workers and the other is an outside shutter worker. The family lives in a small village twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.
Sithach has been a grocery seller for one year. She wants to expand her business by purchasing more grocery items to add in her shop, but haslimited funds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery items for resale and for her stock to increase output.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her stock.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Mrs. Phy K., 54, is widowed and has three children who are employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Phy K. earns income cultivating rice on a piece of land in the Por Pel Khei village in Kandal Province. She currently needs a loan to be able to buy additional rice seeds, fertilizers, and hire workers and two oxen to plow the field.

loans.use: Purchase of rice seeds and fertilizers and hire of labor and two oxen

loans.name: Chrek

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrek T., the 38-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are garment workers while another works in construction, lives in Treal Commune, Kompong Tom Province with her 42-year- old husband, Mr. Thoeun Ket. The couple earns a living by selling vegetables such as cabbages, water lilies, and morning glory that they have purchased wholesale.

Chrek is now requesting a $500 loan to buy additional vegetables to sell and a trailer to use with their motorcycle for more efficient transportation of produce .

loans.use: To buy a trailer and more vegetables.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret K., 70, and his wife, Ouch Chik, 59, live on an island near the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1959 and have three children; one son and two daughters. The children are all married and both sons live outside the family home. The daughter lives at home with her husband and three children.

Saret and his wife have been farming since 1973. They grow ginger, corn, bitter gourd, and pumpkins on their farmland. Sometimes they sell their yield at Derm Kor market in Phnom Penh and sometimes they sell them to the middleman in the village.  

Saret is requesting a loan of $600 for growing more ginger and to help his daughter raise pigs.

loans.use: for growing more ginger and to help his daughter raise pigs

loans.name: Zemaray Group

texts.en: Fahim S.,  who is the group leader is single. He lives in a low rent house in Jalalabad city. He studied until seventh grade. After that he opened a tailoring shop. The other members of the group are  Ershad A. who also has a tailor shop,  Farhad K. who is a taxi driver and Sharif  K. who owns a shop. They are  requesting  a group loan of $850 to improve their businesses. Fahim S. is sure that they can repay the loan on time. He would like to thank everyone who helps with funding this loan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
