loans.name: Prisca Joachim

texts.en: Prisca Joachim M. is a Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a boutique and beauty salon in Kariakoo business center in Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She purchases the business items from wholesale shops in Kariakoo; some are imported from China, India, and Dubai and supplied to customers in Dar es Salaam. From the business she has managed to build her own house and pay school fees for her brothers and sisters. She requests a loan of Tshs1,450,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema I. is a Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a grocery shop in Buza just outside Kariakoo business center. She has been in business for 5 years. She purchases commodities from wholesale shops and sells them to her customers. The income generated helps her to meet her daily family needs and also has enabled her to buy a building site. She requests a loan of Tshs1,480,000 to purchase more items to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Rwebihoro C-Zainabu Group

texts.en:
Zainabu K. is 42 years of age and sells second-hand clothes in the Biharwe market. She earns an average profit of 200,000 UGX per month. From her profits, she pays a monthly market fee of 6,000 UGX. She will use the loan to purchase an additional supply of dresses, shirts, trousers and children’s wear to meet the rising customer demands as the festive season draws near. 

Zainabu is a divorced mother of seven children. She obtained some capital through cash crop farming to start up this business. She works hard to ensure that her business yields an income that can enable her to educate and provide for her children. Her ambition is to import her own consignments of second-hand clothes from the United Kingdom and the United States and also build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of dresses, shirts, trousers and childrens wear

loans.name: Lugazi A-Josephine Group

texts.en:
Josephine Kokumareri, age 40, is a loving and caring guardian to her sister’s 9 year old daughter. She earns a living from her pub business in Lugazi Mbarara which offers a variety of local brand liquor. This earns her 48,000 UGX daily from which she must pay rent of 70,000UGX per month. She has been running the business for over one year and  offers her customer excellent service. Josephine tries to make her pub stand out from the others in her locality by offering free DSTV and GTV entertainment to her customers. 

This business can at times be frustrating. Josephine has to deal with clients who walk away drunk without paying their bills and those who get chaotic and end up breaking glass ware. This though, has not hampered her from expanding her business. She is using the loan proceeds to purchase more local brands of alcohol such as Nile, Bell, Tusker, Waragi, Romi, among others. She is saving some of the profits earned so that she can purchase a pool table for the pub to attract more customers and increase her income. She is more than determined to see her niece through all levels of education.

loans.use: Purchase more local brands of alcohol such as Nile, Bell, Tusker, Waragi, Romi among others.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher A. is a businessman. He has run a shop for 4 years at Vingunguti ward. He sells a variety of items to customers. He purchases the commodities from wholesale shops at Kariakoo shopping center. He manages to meet the daily family needs from the business. He requests a loan of Tshs1200,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Mr. Hassan R.  is married, with six school aged children between ages of 6 and 12. He sells bed sheets on a retail basis along the Ishaka main road. He is using the loan to purchase additional supplies of bed sheets for his shop.

He is a determined man and  has great ambitions. He aspires to own a show room, where various brands of imported beddings would be offered  to meet the needs of customers in this upscale market segment. He also looks forward to increasing the production of crops like plantain and vegetables on his farm.

loans.use: Purchase additional supplies of bed sheets

loans.name: Agip Cell A-Kudra Group

texts.en:
Kudra  N. is a jovial and hard working, single mother of 4,. She operates a restaurant next to the Agip petrol station in Mbarara. She rents the semi permanent structure for 20,000UGX per month. This business came into existence as a result of her small savings. As there is a  lack of the necessary equipment and utensils, the business earns a low income of 5,000UGX per week. She expects that by using the loan to purchase flasks, saucepans, charcoal stoves and other utensils, the business will increase rapidly. With four years experience in the business, her strength in attracting customers has been the remarkable standards of hygiene that she maintains at her premises. For her business to blossom, she wants to install modern chairs, counters and other furniture.

With sufficient funds, Kudra’s desire is to become a matooke (plantain) vendor in the capital where the food is in high demand. Her ambition is to see her children through school and on to university.

loans.use: Purchase flasks, saucepans, charcoal stoves and other equipment

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mrs. Amina B. operates a retail grocery shop that sells a variety of fast moving consumer goods such as toiletries, cereals, and soft drinks, among others. Due to the increased demand for rice in the market and its projected rise in price, Amina is using this loan to purchase sacks of upland rice directly from farmers, at a fair price, that will enable her realize a considerable amount of profit on each sack.

Her business, over the last 12 years, has enabled her to support her husband in the caring of their two children, aged 2 & 6 years old. Her dream is to integrate agricultural activities with her retail business, whereby she would cultivate and then sell her own produce (cereals) in the grocery shop.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of upland rice directly from farmers.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married woman. She has run a shop and café at Makangarawe (BUZA) Ward for 3 years. She purchases the items from the various wholesale shops and then sells them to customers. She supports her family life with the business, including paying her children's school fees. She requests a loan of Tsh800,000 to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Agip Cell A-Saidat Group

texts.en:
Saidat N. is a 48 year old widowed mother of 8 children aged between 30 and 2.5 years. Having been a hardworking cash crop farmer, she managed to raise some capital 3 years ago to start up a food joint/stall. This earns her a profit of 10,000UGX daily. For the success of her business, Saidat will use the loan to purchase the required utensils like saucepans, and foods like matooke, maize flour, and rice.

She works tirelessly towards attaining her ambition of owning a modern restaurant with classic custom made furniture, offering various continental and foreign dishes. With such an achievement, she will be in a position to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: To purchase saucepans and matooke, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Jawadu

texts.en:
Jawadu K. is a specialist in repairing electronics and also sells spare parts for products like radios and televisions among others to his customers. His 5 year old business is located in Kizinda trading center-Ishaka. Being a hard working man, Jawadu has been saving some money to expand his business. However, despite his efforts to increase his capital, the savings have been insufficient and this has made him consider obtaining a loan to fill his capital gap.

He will use the loan proceeds to purchase complete packages of electronics like televisions, radios, flat irons, kettles, among other electrical goods. He is striving hard to ensure that with the increased capital, the business will yield enough income for him to set up a commercial building within Ishaka town, thereby adding to his source of income. This will enable him to see his 3 children, between the ages of 2 and 8, successfully through school.

loans.use: To purchase complete packages of electronics like televisions, radios, flat irons, kettles among other electrical goods.

loans.name: Kisenyi J-Tusiime Group

texts.en:
Joseph Mary T., was a cashier a year ago, but now sells second hand clothes in Mbarara market. Her business fetches a profit of 60,000UGX per week from which she pays a weekly market charge of 6,000UGX. She keeps her customers satisfied by ensuring she stocks quality and fashionable outfits. However, her business is affected by the fluctuating transport costs due to the rise in price of fuel. This hinders her from efficiently reaching distant markets. As the festive season draws near, traders are forecasting a rapid rise in sales with attractive profit margins. Therefore, Mary is bracing herself for this season by purchasing the latest designs of female outfits like dresses, skirts, blouses and trousers. 

Mary is happily married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 0.7. Two of them go to primary school. Her husband sells electrical goods. One of her greatest dreams is to independently import her own stock of clothes from overseas and sell them on a wholesale basis. This will enable her to comfortably support her husband in seeing their children through school.

loans.use: To purchasing the latest designs of female outfits like dresses, skirts, blouses and trousers.

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en:
Besides his profession as a teacher, Leopold D. sells groundnuts, beans, rice, green grams, and peas, among other cereals, in a retail shop he runs in Kizinda trading center. Married with 6 children between the ages of 13 and 27, Leopold works tirelessly to ensure his family’s needs are meet. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of cereals, especially rice and groundnuts, to increase stock in this business which he has successfully been operating over a period of 8 years.

Opening up a private modern primary school is one of his great ambitions, as he plans on retirement from the government service.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cereals, especially rice and groundnuts

loans.name: David

texts.en:
A farmer and teacher by profession, David M. cultivates coffee on his land in Rushozi-Kabwohe. David plans to use the loan to purchase more coffee plants for his farm so as to work towards his dream of being the owner of a large coffee plantation that will qualify him for obtaining a tender to supply coffee beans to the coffee factories for a lump sum.

However, the sky is not the limit for David. He also holds the vision of being the founder of a modern primary school that will offer quality education to students. This loving father of 5 children aged 20-27 years has ensured that his children get the best education and now 4 of them are working. He is only left with 1 child at the university. With the hope that the loan will help his business grow, David has no doubt that his last-born will successfully graduate from the university.

loans.use: purchase more coffee plants for his farm

loans.name: Erica

texts.es: Erica tiene 28 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 3 años llamada Melany. Ella es una joven que se dedica a la venta de artesanías a los turistas en su lugar de nacimiento, la Isla Los Uros, en donde ofrece variedad de artesanías a los turistas que visitan la bonita isla de “Tata Kily”. Erica se ha dedicado a esta labor desde hace 15 años, siendo esta una zona muy concurrida por los turistas, estando acostumbrada, desde muy pequeña, a interactuar con los turistas, gustándole mucho su trabajo. Lo más difícil es el tener que adquirir las artesanías, ya que muchas de ellas las elabora con sus propias manos y otras las adquiere en otros lugares a donde tiene que desplazarse. Erica se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería  y así expandir su negocio  y lograr mayores ingresos, Erica de antemano agradece tu gentil ayuda.
texts.en:
Erica is 28 years, a single mother of a 3 year-old girl named Melany. She sells crafts to tourists at her place of origin; Isla Los Uros where she offers a variety of craftworks to the tourists that visit the pretty island of "Tata Kily." Erica has been doing this for 15 years as this area is crowded with tourists, and since she was very young she has been used to interacting with them, and she enjoys her work very much. The difficulty is to obtain the crafts as she makes many of them with her own hands and others she has to go to different places to buy. This is Erica's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will buy more merchandise to expand her business and get more income. In advance Erica is grateful for your kind help.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise to be sold.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
A welcoming and jovial Harriet B. is a charcoal vendor in Ibanda central market. The nature of her business calls for sufficient capital and this has prompted Harriet to obtain a loan to replenish her stock of charcoal. Her business has been up and running for a period of 7 years and the profit proceeds have enabled her educate and take care of her 5 children aged 5-16.

Being a hard-working lady, Harriet dreams of supplying trucks of charcoal to the major towns, including the capital, on a wholesale basis. From her income, Harriet plans to set up a decent home for her family.

loans.use: replenish her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel K. offers tailoring services in a stall he rents along Jubilee Street in Ibanda town. The business earns an average profit of 150,000 UGX per month. Keeping an eye on the market trends, Samuel forecasts an increased demand for clothes. To keep abreast of competition, he has requested a loan for purchasing more fabrics of various kinds so as to meet the rising demand and varying tastes and preferences of his customers.

This hard-working and caring father of 2 aspires to extend his business by opening up a fancy boutique in the capital that will offer a variety of designer wear imported from overseas. With a stable source of income, nothing can hinder Samuel from sending his children to the best schools in the country and offering his family a decent and modern home.

loans.use: purchasing more fabrics of various kinds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en su propia casa ubicada en la Isla Tata Kily de las Islas flotantes de Los Uros. Se dedica a la venta de artesanías en su isla, ofreciéndolas a los turistas de diferentes países que visitan su acogedor puesto. Desde hace ya un año Lucy vende estas artesanías para mantenerse económicamente y poder forjarse un promisorio provenir. Lo que más le agrada de su labor es el contacto que tiene con los turistas, ya que le encanta conversar con ellos y conocer mediante sus palabras sus países, así como ella comparte la tradición del suyo. Lucy se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de artesanía para vender mucho más a los turistas que frecuentan su isla.
texts.en:
Lucy is 19 years old, single, and lives in her own house located on the Island of Tata Kily of the floating islands of Los Uros. She is an artisan on her island, offering her wares to the tourists from different countries who visit her stand. For a year now, Lucy has sold her artisan crafts in order to maintain herself economically and to be able to envision a stable income. What pleases her most about her work, is the contact that she has with the tourists, since she loves to chat with them and knows a few words of their countries. In this way she is able to share her tradition with them. Lucy is looking for her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will purchase a larger quantity of artisan crafts so she can sell much more to the tourists that frequent her island.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity of artisan crafts

loans.name: Belthe

texts.en:
Greetings from Belthe N. in Kimironko market in Kigali, Rwanda! Belthe is a young single entrepreneur of 25 years. She started her business in 1999 selling different items in the Kigali central market like bags of rice, cooking oil, clothes, bars of soap, detergents, cooking pots, and all other items used in households.

This entrepreneur started her business with a working capital of $180, which she had gotten after working as a shop attendant for 3 years. In the past years, Belthe has grown her business to a $400 working capital. Besides the business, she owns a barber’s shop for cutting men’s hair.

This client is applying for a loan of 515,000 Frws to buy more stock for her business since Christmas is approaching and she is expecting to get more clients. Her loan term is 12 months, repaid monthly.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Sipriana

texts.es: Sipriana tiene 40 años, vive sola ya que es soltera. Se dedica a vender fruta en las diferentes islas flotantes de los Uros, en su pequeño bote, con el cual va de isla en isla vendiendo sus productos. Esta labor la realiza desde hace un año atrás, Sipriana ha ido incursionando en diferentes negocios para ganarse la vida,  trabajando desde muy temprana edad y no pudiendo concluir sus estudios secundarios. Le va bien en la venta, es por eso que quiere aumentar la cantidad de fruta que vende y así lograr mejores ingresos, es por eso que recurre a nosotros para lograr esta tan ansiada meta. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado incrementará la cantidad de fruta  que vende para ofrecer a los habitantes de las islas flotantes de los Uros.
texts.en:
Sipriana is 40 years old, is single, and lives alone. She sells fruits on the different floating islands of Los Uros from her small boat, with which she goes from island to island selling her products. She began this work a year ago. Sipriana has endeavored in different businesses to earn a living, working from a very early age without being able to finish her high school education. Her sales are going well, so she wants to increase the quantity of fruit that she sells and increase her income. For this she returns to us to accomplish this very pressing goal. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will increase the quantity of fruit that she sells in order to provide more products to the islanders.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of fruit she sells

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 25 años, vive sola ya que es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en su pequeña tienda, la cual administra desde hace ya 5 años, gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos. En el negocio le va bien, le gusta la venta, su capacidad de persuasión y su gran facilidad de palabra logran convencer y dibujar una sonrisa en el rostro de sus clientes, los cuales ya se van siendo más fieles a la tienda de Adela, no solo por los buenos productos que ofrece, si no también para conversar y alegrarse el día con las bromas que ella realiza. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita implementará mejor su tienda para tener a todos sus fieles clientes contentos con sus productos.
texts.en:
Adela is 25 years old, lives by herself, and is single. She sells sweets in her small store, which she has managed for 5 years thanks to her great efforts. Her business is going well and she enjoys it. Her capacity for persuasion and her great ability for conversation allows her to convince and bring a smile to the faces of her clients. Her clients are very loyal to Adela, not only because of the great products that she offers, but also for her conversation and joy she gives them with her jokes. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will obtain more supplies for her store to keep all her faithful clients happy with her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products offered in her store.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tiene 24 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas Estefani de 14 y Xiomara de 6. Ella es una madre que en bienestar de sus dos pequeñas hijas se dedica al tejido de prendas, para luego vender en los mercados de la ciudad de Puno. Felicitas le dedica a su trabajo todo el día, ya que cuando no está tejiendo sus prendas, tiene que salir a venderlas. La venta le da muy bien, es por eso que quiere agrandar su producción. Lo difícil es elaborarlas, ya que las cantidades que le solicitan a veces escapan a sus posibilidades. Este es su primer préstamo a Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 24 years old and a single mother of two children, Estefani, 14, and Xiomara, 6. She is a mother that, for the well being of her two small daughters, weaves rugs to later sell in the markets of Puno. Felicitas works all day, since when she is not making rugs, she is out selling them. Her sales are going very well, and because of this she wants to increase her production. It is difficult to create the rugs, since the quantities that are requested sometimes escape her capabilities. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting she will buy a larger quantity of materials to weave her rugs.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase more materials for weaving.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday O. repairs bicycles and motorcycles. He is 39 years old and married with 2 children. His wife is a trader. He needs a loan of N30,000 to purchase more motorcycle materials to sell. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Ines tiene 22 años, convive con su pareja y su hija de 3 años llamada Abigail. Cuando empezó a vivir con su pareja, con el deseo de aportar ingresos a su hogar incursionó en el negocio de la venta de zapatillas y otras prendas, el puesto que  tiene está junto al de su suegra, la cual la apoyó para iniciarse en este negocio. Lo que le gusta es apoyar en la economía familiar y sentirse útil, es por eso que le pone todas las ganas y esfuerzo para hacer que su negocio prospere. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos y hacer que su familia tenga mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ines is 22 years old, lives with her husband and her daughter of 3 years named Abigail. When she started living with her husband, she desired to provide income for their home so she started her business selling sandals and other apparel. She shares the stand with her mother-in-law, who supported her in starting the business. What she likes about her work is supporting the family economically and feeling useful. For this reason, she puts all of her will and effort into making her business prosperous. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will purchase a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her earnings and make sure that her family has better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Kate Joy

texts.en: Kate is a tailor. She also sells tailoring materials to her customers. She makes lovely designs and her customers like her work. Kate is happy because this festive season will increase the demand for her tailoring skills. She is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She needs a loan of N40,000 ($350) to purchase more tailoring materials like zippers, threads, needles, buttons, etc. to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Leo

texts.es: Leo tiene 22 años es soltero, vive de forma independiente en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de cigarros, los cuales vende de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Puno. Leo siempre ha tratado de sobresalir y forjarse un futuro, pese a su juventud, su pensamiento es muy maduro y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que le pone tanto empeño a su trabajo, el cual le viene arrojado buenas ganancias. Leo se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado incrementará su mercadería, así quiere obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Leo is 22 years old, single, supports himself and lives in his parent’s home. For a year he has sold cigarettes, which he sells as a street vendor in the city of Puno. Leo has always aimed to be successful and forge a future for himself. In spite of his youth, his thinking is very mature and he has great desire to be successful and therefore he puts a lot of effort into his work which in turn provides him good income. This is Leo’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will increase his merchandise and in this way obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise he sells

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es: Marcosa tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos Germán de 11, Lesli de 7 y Silvia de 3 años de edad, viven en la casa de sus padres. Ella se dedica al tejido de prendas, las cuales vende  por pedidos, usualmente elabora los “deditos” que son una especie de pequeñas marionetas tejidas a lana los cuales son muy solicitados por los turistas. Además elabora guantes, chompas, etc. Su trabajo comienza desde muy temprano y le toma casi todo el día elaborar estas prendas. Marcosa se encuentra en el primer préstamo a Micro finanzas Prisma, comprometida a ser puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de lana para producir más prendas y poder venderlas.
texts.en:
Marcosa is 30 years old, a single mother, with three children: Germán age 11, Lesli age 7 and Silvia age 3. They live in her parent’s home. Marcosa sells clothing items that she knits, selling on order, usually making “deditos” which are a type of small puppet made of wool and purchased by tourists. In addition, she makes gloves, sweaters, etc. Her work begins very early in the morning and she takes almost the entire day making items. This is Marcosa’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy a quantity of wool to produce more items and be able to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of wool to make knitted items to sell

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Adesuwa I. sells provisions and drinks. Her husband makes furniture such as chairs and tables. She is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She needs a loan of N40,000 ($350) to purchase more food items and drinks to sell. She says a big thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 37 años, es soltero, vive en al casa que sus padres le dejaron. Es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 4 años a la construcción, es albañil de profesión y ha trabajado en diversidad de obras, las cuales muestra orgulloso. A Raúl siempre le ha gustado construir, tiene todo un equipo a su mando con los cuales se encarga de construir por contrato casas, oficinas, etc.  Gracias a la experiencia que ha ganado es muy solicitado por las diferentes personas que requieren de sus servicios, quedando satisfechos con el acabado final. Lo más difícil es el tener que construir solamente con las herramientas básicas, teniendo que pasar algunos inconvenientes por este motivo. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar herramientas nuevas y más eficaces para la elaboración de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Raúl is 37 years old, single, and he lives in a house left to him by his parents. Hi is a hard working man who has worked in construction for 4 years as a bricklayer. He has completed a variety of projects and is very proud of his work. Raúl has always liked construction, he has a team of workers with whom he builds, on contract, houses, offices, etc. Thanks to this experience he is sought after by different people who require his services and they are satisfied with the final products. The most difficult thing about the work is having to build with only basic tools, and he has had to turn down some work because of this. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan he wants to buy new, more efficient masonry tools.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new masonry tools

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. sells provisions and drinks. She is 28 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años, vive con sus hijos Omar de 15 y Sheyla de 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un triciclo en una de las plazas más conocidas de la ciudad de Puno, desde hace 22 años. Rosa no pudo cursar estudios secundarios, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar para solventar sus gastos, es así que optó por la venta de golosinas, las cuales se venden muy bien por esa zona, ya que queda cerca de colegios, institutos, etc. Lo más difícil para Rosa es tener que permanecer casi todo el día bajo el calor del sol y por las tardes soportar el frió inclemente de la zona, aun así, sabe que gracias a su trabajo ella puede mantener a sus hijos y brindarles comida y educación. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and lives with her children Omar, age 15, and Sheyla, age 8. She has sold candy from a tricycle in one of the popular plazas in the city of Puno for 22 years. Rosa did not finish secondary school, as since she was very young she had to work to meet her expenses, so she opted to sell candy which sells very well in this zone as it is close to schools, institutes, etc. The most difficult thing for Rosa is having to work almost every day under the hot sun and in the evenings withstand the inclement cold of the area. However, she knows that thanks to this work she can support her children and provide them food and an education. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Primsa. With the money she will buy a large quantity of candy to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of candy to resell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris I. is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks and provisions and has been in this business for a long time. Her husband is a teacher in a private school. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 51 años, vive sola debido a que quedó viuda y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta de animales menores, como cuyes, gallinas, etc., los cuales cría en su pequeña casa y luego sale a venderlos en la feria sabatina de la ciudad de Puno. A Rosa siempre le gustaron los animales, cuidarlos y alimentarlos hace que se encariñe con ellos haciendo que le guste su trabajo. Por otro lado, lo peor es el tener que dejarlos, e ir a venderlos, ya que ella se encariña mucho con ellos. El negocio va muy bien y Rosa le dedica mucho tiempo, ya que está sola y sus animales son su única distracción. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Rosa quiere invertir el dinero que está solicitando en la compra de más animales, de alimento para ellos y para arreglar y ampliar su criadero.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and lives alone due to the fact that she became a widow and has had no children. She makes a living selling small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, etc., which she raises in her own home and later goes to sell them at the Saturday market in the city of Puno. Rosa has always liked animals, taking care of them and feeding them makes her become fond of them, which makes her enjoy her work. At the same time, she hates to have to leave them and go to sell them, since she has grown to care for them so very much. The business is doing very well and Rosa dedicates a lot of her time to it, especially since she is alone and the animals are her only distraction. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Rosa wants to invest the funds that she is requesting in the purchase of more animals, food for them, and to fix and enlarge the kennel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of animals that she has for sale.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia Omorogbe sells provisions and drinks. She also grinds cereals like corn and millet. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 63 years old and married with 6 children. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de tres hijas, Kelly de 11 años, Kriselly de 5 y Angiely de 1. Se dedica a la venta de prendas tejidas a mano, las cuales vende en las ferias locales y también por pedidos, logando que las ventas sean buenas y obtenga buenos ingresos. A Ruth le gustó tejer desde muy niña, no pensó que esta actividad se convertiría en su primera fuente de sustento económico. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es ir contra el tiempo y acabar todos los pedidos que le realizan, pero ella está acostumbrada a la presión y cree que si sigue trabajando tan arduamente cosechará los frutos de su trabajo muy pronto. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. on el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de lana para realizar sus tejidos, y aumentar la variedad de colores y diseños para hacerlos más atractivos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 31-year-old single mother of three daughters — Kelly is 11, Kriselly is 5 and Angiely is 1. She makes a living selling hand-woven clothes at the local open-air markets and also by order. She has been able to achieve good sales and a good income. Ruth has enjoyed weaving since she was a very young girl, but she didn't think that the activity would become her primary source of economic support. The most difficult part of her job is the race against time and finishing all the orders she receives, but she has gotten used to the the pressure and believes that if she keeps working so arduously she will enjoy the fruits of her labor very soon. This is her first loan through Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and the money she is requesting will be used to purchase larger quantities of wool so she can add more variety of colors and designs to her items and make them more attractive to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe benkadi sont des femmes mariées vivant dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne deux enfants.
Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariage et de voisinage et résident toutes à sanankoroba.

Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako soit aux marchés du village et environnants dex fois par mois.
Avec ce prêt elles désirent avoir  100  kilogrammes de condiments et  800  kilogrammes degraines d’arachide pour réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 44.000 FCFA  à fin de payer l’intérêt du prêt et participer aux dépenses de la famille.

Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
A travers l’association siguidja du village, elles ont intégré le programme de prêt solidaire de soro yiriwa so pour faire prospéré leurs révenus.
texts.en:
The members of this Benkadi group are married women living in polygamous households with an average of 2 children each. They met because of ties of marriage and neighborhood, and all reside in Sanankoroba.

They do their buying either in Bamako (the capital of Mali) or in the market in their vilage and neighboring ones, two times a month.

With this loan they would like to have 100 kg of condiments and 800 kg of peanuts to make an average monthly profit of 44,000 F CFA to use to make repayments on the loan and help out with family living expenses.

They are on their 6th loan, with all preceding loans correctly reimbursed. Through the village Siguidja association, they joined the solidarity loan program of Soro Yiriwaso so that they could boost their incomes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments, peanuts, and cosmetics for women

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet tiene 19 años, vive en casa de su familia. La venta de ropa es  la labor con la cual Yanet se gana la vida, ella ha incursionado en este negocio desde hace cuatro años atrás, al culminar sus estudios secundarios. Lo que le gusta a Yanet de su trabajo es la dinamisidad que requiere la venta de ropa, debe convencer a la clientela de adquirir sus prendas, y así lograr buenos ingresos, lo cual es muy bueno, ya que le va muy bien con las ventas, pensando en expandir su negocio. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de prendas para lograr mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Yanet is 19 years old and lives at home with her family. She makes a living selling clothes, which she starting doing four years ago after finishing her junior high school education. What Yanet enjoys about her work is the dynamic personality need to sell clothes, negotiating with customers to purchase her items so she can earn a good income, which she has, since her sales have gone very well. She is planning on expanding her business. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzaz Prisma. With the money she is requesting she will purchase a larger quantity of clothing so she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of clothing to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara A. sells clothing. She has been in this business for many years. She is 47 years old and married with 4 children. Clara purchases her clothes from Lagos and Onitsha to sell in Benin City. With the festive period fast approaching, she hopes to increase her stock. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 23 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres. Para solventar sus gastos se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 2 años, siendo ella tan joven siempre ha querido forjarse un futuro mejor, es por eso que decidió incursionar en este negocio. Trabaja desde las 5 a.m. hasta aproximadamente las 7 a.m., elaborando el pan para luego distribuirlo por las tiendas. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la elaboración del pan, ya que ella trabaja con un horno casero, con el cual el ambiente llega a temperaturas un tanto excesivas, aún así Yesenia sabe que la única manera de progresar es trabajando muy duro y es por eso que busca mejorar día a día. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor cantidad de insumos e ingredientes para elaborar pan, además de algunos accesorios para que su pequeña panadería pueda ser mucho más productiva y le arroje mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 23 years old and single, and she lives at home with her parents. To be able to make ends meet, she has been making a living by baking and selling bread for the past two years. Being that she is so young, she has always wanted to work toward a better future, which is why she decided to start the bakery. She works from approximately 5-7 a.m. baking the bread, which she then distributes to various stores. The most difficult part about her job is making the bread, since she bakes with her home oven and the temperature can get quite excessive. However, Yesenia knows that the only way to make progress is to keep working very hard, and that's why she looks to improve from day to day. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting she will purchase a larger quantity of ingredients to make her breads, as well as buy some accessories so her small bakery can be much more productive and she can earn a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of ingredients

loans.name: Sumacc Huayta Group

texts.en:
Twelve members of the Sumacc Huayta Village Bank in Pucapampa  (in the Yauli District of Huancavelica Department) will share this loan. The area has beautiful barns, and nearby women graze their sheep and cattle. 

Elysa R. is married and has two children, ages 3 and 6. She has a store, which she has been able to expand thanks to the loans she has received from FINCA. She sells meals to neighbors, teachers, and nurses. Her mother has cancer, but she and her sisters work at their business and do quite well. She will use her loan to buy vegetables and meat. Her dream is to open a large restaurant; this is why she is saving her money. 

Antonia V. sells cheese and eggs. She buys locally maD. gloves and socks from her associates, which she then takes to Lima to sell. Antonia is illiterate and is the president of her community’s Mothers’ Club. She will use her loan to buy buckets for her cheese. Her dream is to have her own textile production facility. 

Marcelina H. is married and has five children. She sells boiled potatoes and eggs. She is happy because before, no one would give her a loan. she needs to buy more eggs and potatoes as well as a new basket to carry them in. She plans to use her savings to buy durable boots for farm work.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Bancomunal Sumacc Huayta, esta ubicado en Pucapampa en el distrito D. Yauli en el departamento D. Huancavelica, es una zona con parajes lindos, donD. mujeres pastean sus ovejas y vacas. 

Elysa R.,  es casado y tiene 2 hijos D. 6 y 3 años, tiene una tienda que ha crecido gracias a los prestamos que recibe, venD. comida a los pasajeros, profesores y enfermeros. Su mama tiene cáncer, pero ella y sus hermanos trabajan en su negocio y les va bien. Aprovechara su préstamo en comprar verduras y carne. Su sueño es tener un restaurante granD., para ello esta ahorrando.

Antonia V., venD. queso y huevo. Recolectando D. sus compañeros trae a Lima guantes y medias que venD.. Antonia es iletrada y es presidenta del club D. madres D. su comunidad. Su préstamo lo invertirá en comprar baldes para sus quesos. Su sueño es tener una fabrica D. textileria.

Marcelina H., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, su negocio es la venta D. papas sancochadas y huevo en los carros, esta contenta porque nadie le daba préstamos, ella necesita para comprar mas huevos y papas y una canasta nueva, con sus ahorros comprara sus zapatos D. jebe.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and meat

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe danaya sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne quatre (4) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et résident toutes à selingué.

Spécialisées dans la vente de céréales, elles s’approvisionnent sur les marchés de selingué et ceux des villages environnants chaque semaine. Ensuite le stock ainsi constitué est cédé à des grossistes venant de Bamako.
Avec ce prêt de 50.000FCFA par femme, elles comptent acquérir  500  kilogrammes  de céréales et de grains d’arachide. Le bénéfice moyen mensuel est estimé à 15.000 FCFA qui leur permetra de régler leurs dépenses quotidiennes familiales et de payer les interets du prêt..
texts.en:
The members of this Danaya group are married women living in general in polygamous families with on average 4 children. They met because they are neighbors, all residing in Selingué.

Specialized in selling cereals, they do their buying every week in the markets of Selingué and those of neighboring villages. Then the stocks that they have put together are turned over to wholesalers coming from Bamako (the capital of Mali).

With this loan of 50,000 F CFA per member, they expect to be able to buy 500 kg of cereals and peanuts. The average monthly profit is estimated to be 15,000 F CFA which will allow them to cover their daily family expenses and make repayments on the loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peanuts, condiments, and cereals

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen O. is 38 years old and married with four children. Queen is a retailer and sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, garri, etc.  She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more products to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose E. sells provisions and drinks. She is 48 years old and married with 6 children. Some of her children have graduated from the university. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers with this loan. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Djèkafo Group

texts.fr:
Vivant dans la localité de Sanankoroba (situé à  25  kilomètres de Bamako la capital du Mali), les membres du groupe djèkafo sont des femmes mariéesavec en moyenne cinq (5) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens d’amitié et de mariage. 
Pour la survie de leur pétit commerce, elles ont intégré le programme de prêt solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso à travers l’association siguidja du village et elles sont à leur sixième prêt tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
Elles s’approvisionnent toutes en diverses denrées alimentaires  à Bamako une fois par mois. En plus de la vente des denrées alimentaires certains membres font de la restauration. Avec ce prêt elles comptent acquérir 90  kilogrammes de fruits et légumes et  105   kilogrammes  de divers denrées alimentaires. Le bénéfice previsionnel mensuel est estimé à 25.000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djèkafo are married women who have five children on average. They live in the Sanankoroba area (located 25 km from Bamako, the capital of Mali) and know one another by ties of friendship and marriage.

For their small business to survive, they joined the solidarity loan program Soro Yiriwaso through the village association Siguidja. They are on their sixth loan. All of their previous loans have been repaid.

They all get their supplies of diverse foodstuffs in Bamako once a month. In addition to selling these goods, some members do catering. With this loan, they intend to acquire 90 kg of fruit and vegetables and 105 kg of various food items. The projected monthly profit is estimated at 25,000 francs CFA.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stock of fruit and vegetables for some and to buy groceries for catering for others

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria I. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells provisions and drinks in small quantities. She hopes to purchase provisions and drinks to sell to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more products. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, etc. The demand for the food on her menu is high and she hopes to meet the needs of her customers during this festive season. She is 43 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband works as a receptionist in a hotel. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe sabali sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec une moyenne d’age  de 41 ans et quatre (4) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et résident à sanankoroba (village situé à  25  kilomètres de Bamako la capitale du Mali).

Ayant deja bénéficié de 6 prêts de groupe, elles comptent utiliser le prêt actuel pour s’approvisionner en tubercules et en fruit dans les marchés des villages environnants deux fois par mois pour les révendre en détail au marché de Sanankoroba.

Elles comptent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 43.000FCFA pour payer les intérêts du prêt et subvénir aux bésoins de leurs familles. Elles espèrent augmenter le montant de leur prêt pour diversifier leurs articles à fin de mieux servir la clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabali are married women living generally in polygamous households and who average 41 years of age and four children. They know one another by ties of community and reside in Sanankoroba (a village located 25 km from Bamako, the capital of Mali).

Having already benefited from six group loans, they intend to use the current loan to get supplies of tubers and fruit at the marketplaces of surrounding villages twice a month. These goods would be resold at the retail level at the Sanankoroba marketplace.

With this loan, they intend to realize an average monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA to pay their loan interest and to support their families. They hope to have a larger loan amount to diversify their goods in order to serve their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tubers, fruit, soap, and various items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 26 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions like sugar, milk, cornflakes etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade S. is a tailor who sews clothes of various styles for people in his community. He is 56 years old and married with 6 children. He needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell and to make his customers' clothing. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy I. is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She sells foodstuffs like plantain, garri, tomato paste, and pepper. Her husband is a civil servant. She needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more food products to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Tiene un estudio fotográfico desde hace 5 años, este negocio es el fruto de su deseo de ser independiente, atiende todos los días, durante casi todo el día para poder tener los ingresos necesarios para poder cubrir los gastos de arrendamiento, así como el de los materiales que utiliza para imprimir las fotos, como el papel impresión y mantenimiento de sus máquinas. De esta manera, Ana es un sostén importante para su familia, sobre todo por sus 2 hijos que están estudiando en el colegio, por lo cual ella espera mejorar su calidad de vida en los próximos años. Es la segunda vez que Ana solicita un préstamo en MFP, durante el primero demostró ser puntual en sus pagos. Ahora solicita este préstamo parta comprar una máquina impresora de fotos.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She has run a photography studio for the past 5 years which is the fruit of her desire to be independent. She works in the studio every day for almost the entire day in order to have enough income to cover rent and materials which she uses to print the photos; these include printing paper and the maintenance of her machines. In this way, Ana provides sustenance for her family, especially for her two children who are still in school. She hopes to be able to improve the quality of life for her children in the next few years. This is the second time that Ana has requested a loan from MFP; she was very punctual in her payments on her first loan. Now she is requesting this loan in order to purchase a photo printing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photo printing machine

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Résidant dans la localité de Fana (Sous prefecture de Yanfolila dans la 3e région administrative du Mali), les membres du groupe sabougnouma sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne quatre (4) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariage et vivent toutes à sélingué.

Elles s’approvisionnent à sélingué chaque sémaine et vendent sur place. Pour pouvoir mener des activités génératrices de revenus, elles ont décidé d’integrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles comptent utiliser ce premier prêt pour acheter  800  kilogrammes de fruits et  600  kilogrammes de céréales pour réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 26.000 FCFA par membre qui aidera à faire face aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Residing in the Fana area (sub-prefecture of Yanfolila in the third administrative region of Mali), the members of the group Sabougnouma are married women generally in polygamous households who have on average four children. They know one another by ties of marriage and all live in Sélingué.

They get their supplies in Sélingué each week and make sales locally. To be able to operate and earn income, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They intend to use this initial loan to buy 800 kg of fruit and 600 kg of grains to realize an average monthly profit of 26,000 francs CFA per member that will help to address family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, tubers, and grains

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita is a member of the Suni ("Abundance" in Quechua) Village Bank. She lives in her sister’s house in the Los Olivos neighborhood. Hipolita travels to local markets twice a week to buy small animals and cheese. She slaughters some of the animals herself, and brings others to a local slaughterhouse. She brings the meat and cheese to the city of Ayacucho to sell in different markets.
Hipolita also sells sweets at night for different social gatherings and parties. She needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy cows and cheese.  Hipolita’s dreams are to own her own home, to educate her children so that they can graduate with professional degrees, and to have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Hipólita es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. 

Hipólita es separada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Hipólita vive en la Asoc. Los Olivos en casa de su hermana, Hipólita viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región dos veces por semana en donde compra animales menores, quesos, sus productos los transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo comercializa en los distintos mercados, los animales los beneficia en el camal y también en su casa. 

Además Hipólita vende golosinas en las diferentes fiestas sociales y patronales, actividad que realiza por las noches. 

Hipólita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carneros y quesos. 

Los sueños de Hipólita son tener casa propia, educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y tener un negocio estable.

loans.use: Buy small animals and cheese

loans.name: Aliratu

texts.en: Aliratu is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children.  She sells provisions and foodstuffs, as well as  children’s toys and household items. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N30,000 to purchase more provisions and food products to sell to her customers in wholesale and retail.  Aliratu says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan E. is 27 years old and married with 6 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Her husband is a teacher. She needs the loan amount of N20,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all who make this loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She is 50 years old, married and has 8 children. Her husband is a farmer.  She sells provisions and foodstuffs and hopes to increase her sales during this festive season. Esther needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Soutara Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe soutara sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne cinq (5) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et résident toutes à sélengué (sous prefecture de Yanfolila dans la 3e région administrative du Mali).
Pour insuffler une nouvelle envergure à leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours au service de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt et le prémier prêt a été bien remboursé.
Elles s’pprovisionnent sur place et vendent sur place à l’étale ou en ambulant. Avec ce pret les femmes du groupe soutara comptent acheter 400  kilogrammes de graines d’arachide et beaucoup d’articles divers pour réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 36.000 FCFA par membre destiné à couvrir les dépenses familliales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Soutara are married women living generally in polygamous households and who have five children on average. They know one another by ties of community, and they all reside in Sélengué (sub-prefecture of Yanfolila in the third administrative region of Mali).

To infuse a new significance into their business, they decided on turning towards the services of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second loan, their first loan having been repaid.

They get their supplies locally and sell their goods either through their displays or by going door-to-door. With this loan, the women of the group each intend to buy 400 kg of peanuts and many items of different sorts in order to realize an average monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA for covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, tubers, and various items

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is 43 years old and is married with five children. She sells eggs wholesale and retail to her customers. She started the business in 2007. Rosemary's husband is an automobile mechanic.

Rosemary hopes to meet the demands of her customers, and needs a loan in the amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more crates of eggs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 26 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Trabaja cada día en su propio estudio fotográfico, en un pequeño local que arrendó en sociedad con una de sus tías, la impulsó el querer trabajar de manera independiente y de esta manera apoyar a sus padres. Ella atiende en su estudio fotográfico de lunes a sábado durante todo el día, sabe que los meses de mejores ingresos en su negocio son de diciembre a febrero, por ello se está preparando e implementando sus equipos fotográficos para ofrecer  un servicio de mayor calidad, ella realiza este esfuerzo para salir adelante, pensando en su futuro. Es la segunda vez que está solicitando un préstamo en MFP, ha sido puntual en sus pagos en el ciclo anterior. Berta solicita este dinero con el que podrá implementar más su estudio fotográfico con papel de impresión y una impresora fotográfica.
texts.en:
Bertha is 26 years old and lives with her parents and siblings. She works every day in her own photo studio in a small shop that she rents in a partnership with one of her aunts. She wants to work on her own in order to help support her parents. She attends to the customers in the studio all day from Monday to Saturday. The best months for her to make money in her business are from December to February; this is why she is trying to set up new photographic equipment in order to offer a better service to her customers. She puts forth a lot of effort in her business in order to create a better future for herself. This is the second loan she has requested from MFP and she was very punctual in her payments on her first loan. Berta is requesting this loan in order to set her studio up with printing paper and a photo printer.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photo printer

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Magnolia Village Bank. Elsa is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in a rental home in the Conchopata neighborhood. She sells clothing for adults and children as well as shoes; the items she sells varies depending on the requests she receives. She sells to her friends and family members in cash and on credit. Elsa is a teacher, though she is not currently working as a teacher. She plans to use her loan of 3000 PEN to buy toys and clothing for the Christmas season. 
Elsa dreams of having her own store in a fixed location, owning her own home, and providing her children with a good education. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal  Magnolia. 
Elsa es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Elsa vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio de Conchopata. Elsa vende ropa de niños, adultos, zapatos, dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga, sus ventas los realiza a sus amigos, familiares y al crédito. Además Elsa es docente y por esta temporada no esta trabajando. Elsa tiene proyectado comprar juguetes y ropa de niños y aprovechar la campaña navideña. 
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes y ropa. 
Elsa sueña con tener un negocio propio en un local estable, tener casa propia y sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Buy toys and clothing for the Christmas season

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus C. is 48 years old and is married with three children. Linus sells automobile spare parts in Benin City. The location of his store provides him with additional customers. He is a LAPO client. This is his basic source of income.

Linus needs a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more automobile spare parts to sell. Linus thanks everyone that has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 8 años. Trabaja diariamente en la atención de su estudio fotográfico, donde ofrece servicio de fotografías, para trámites de documentos de identidad, pasaporte, revelados, entre otros. Para ello arrendó un local adicional para tener un espacio cómodo para tomar las fotografías de sus clientes, y está cercano a su negocio. Para ofrecer sus servicios Elizabeth tiene una muestra de sus fotografías en la mano, trabaja durante todo el día para poder obtener una ganancia considerable. Es la segunda vez que Elizabeth está solicitando un préstamo en MFP, en el primer ciclo demostró ser puntual en sus pagos, razón por la cual está siendo considerada para renovar este ciclo. Está solicitando esta cantidad para adquirir una cámara digital que le permita obtner fotografías de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their 8 year old son. She works every day in her photo studio where she offers to take photos of customers for their ID documents, passports, and develops film as well. She has rented an additional space nearby in order to have a more comfortable area to take pictures of her customers. To acquire customers, Elizabeth shows them a sample of her work. She works all day to try to earn a sustainable income. This is the second loan she has requested from MFP and she was very punctual with payments on her first loan which is why she is being considered for this second loan. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase a digital camera to take higher quality pictures.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo. Ella trabaja desde hace 6 años con su estudio fotográfico, ofreciendo el servicio de toma de fotografías para todo tipo de tramites y eventos, también toma fotografías en eventos sociales como ceremonias, graduaciones y demás, así puede solventarse, está muy orgullosa de que durante muchos años sostuvo a sus 3 hijos, los que hoy son personas adultas e independientes, por ello ahora Gloria solo trabaja para sostenerse ella misma y su esposo, él que también trabaja, pero en otra actividad. Por su parte, ella disfruta de realizar esta actividad. Es la segunda vez que Gloria solicita un préstamo en MFP, es una de las clientes que cumple puntualmente  los pagos. Ella esta solicitando este dinero para compra de una cámara digital de mayor resolución.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and lives with her husband. She has worked 6 years with her photography studio, offering the service of taking photographs for all types of events, she also takes photos in social events like ceremonies, graduations, and this is how she is able to sustain herself. She is very proud that during many years she has sustained her three children, who are now independent adults, because of this Gloria now only works to sustain herself and her husband, who also works, but in a different field. For her part, she enjoys this activity. This is the second time Gloria has asked for a loan in MFP, and she is one of the clients who punctually completes her payments. She is asking for this money to buy a digital camera with better resolution.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a digital camera

loans.name: Madalene

texts.en:
Madalene U. is 45 years old and is married with five children. Madalene lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Madelene sells loaves of bread at ring road. She sometimes hawks the loaves of bread from street to street.

Madelene needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase additional loaves of bread to sell. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Dignidad (Dignity) Village Bank. Isabel 32 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. Isabel travels to different regional fairs once a week to buy  small animals, trout, and cheese. She then delivers the products to her clients’ homes (she has a fixed client base). Isabel needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy animals, cheese, and trout. Her dreams are to open a large neighborhood store in her home and to continue to work. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad. 
Isabel es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Isabel viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región una vez por semana en donde compra animales menores, trucha, queso y todo lo que pueda comprar, sus productos los comercializa de casa en casa a sus clientes ya estable. 
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero, queso, trucha. 
Los sueños de Isabel son tener una bodega grande en su casa y continuar y trabajando.

loans.use: Buy small animals, trout, and cheese

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe tièssiri sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne quatre (04) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariage et de voisinage et résident toutes à sanankoroba village situé à  25  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali). 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 20 cartons de savons,  60  kilogrammes de divers condiments et legumes. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako ou à la foire du village et environnant une fois par mois pour vendre en étale ou en ambulant.
Par souci d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie, elles intégrèrent le programme de prêt solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso à travers l’association siguidja du village. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt et tout les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui leurs permet de payer l’intérêt du prêt et participer aux dépenses de leur famille. Elles désirent renforcer leurs capacités de vente et améliorer leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
The members of the group Tièssiri are married women living generally in polygamous households and who have four children on average. They know one another by ties of marriage and community, and they all reside in Sanankoroba, a village located 25 km from Bamako (capital of Mali).

With this loan, they intend to buy 20 boxes of soap, 60 kg of various condiments, and vegetables. Once a month, they get their supplies in Bamako or at the village fair and nearby areas in order to make sales, either through their displays or by going door-to-door.

Concerned about improving their living conditions, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso solidarity loan program through the village association Siguidja. They are on their sixth loan. All the previous loans have been repaid.

Using this loan, they intend to realize an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will enable them to pay the loan interest and to help cover family expenses. They would like to boost their sales capacity and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps, used clothing, vegetables, and condiments

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace un año decidió emprender su propio negocio de manera estable, antes lo hacia de manera ambulante, para ello arrendó un puesto de mercado cercano a su casa, para poder vender todos los días diversos artículos de uso personal, como útiles de escritorio, detalles para regalos, entre otros. Yudith está motivada cada día por sus hijos, que son su razón de seguir. Es la  primera vez que Yudith solicita un préstamo en MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Solicita esta cantidad para invertirla en la compra de juguetes y aprovechar la venidera campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Yudith is 36, and lives with her husband and her three children. A year ago she decided to open her own business of a stable nature, before it was in a traveling way, for this she rented a spot in a market close to her house, to be able to sell every day various personal uses, like office supplies and supplies for gifts among others. Yudith is motivated every day by her children, who are her reason to continue. This is the first time that Yudith is asking for a loan in MFP, so she promises to be punctual in her payments. She is asking for this amount to invest in purchasing toys and trying to sell for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying toys for the holiday season

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Justa tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo e hijos. Vende los productos de su cosecha en el mercado todos los días, lo viene haciendo desde hace 20 años, ella produce principalmente cebolla, zanahoria y papa. Todos los miércoles,  que son los días de mayor venta es cuando puede obtener mayores ganancias, por ello que nunca deja de dedicarse a las arduas tareas del campo; la siembra, el cuidado de los cultivos y luego cosecha. Sus planes son producir más, a fin de incrementar sus ventas y repartir al por mayor  sus productos. Es la quinta vez que Justa solicita un préstamo en MFP, demostrando ser cumplida y puntual en sus cuotas. Este dinero lo solicita para comprar sacos de urea y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Justa is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children. She sells the crops from her fields at the market everyday, as she has been doing for 20 years. She grows mainly onions, carrots and potatoes. Every Wednesday, which is when sales increase, she can obtain greater profits. For this reason, she never stops being so dedicated to the arduous tasks of the field—planting, growing and harvesting. She plans to produce more crops so that she can boost sales and distribute her produce wholesale. This is the fifth time that she requests a loan from MFP, demonstrating that she is responsible and punctual with her payments. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase sacks of urea fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of urea fertilizer

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Dignidad (Dignity) Village Bank. Cirila is 46 years old and married with five children. Cirila sells coca leaves in small towns in the Huancavelica department (she travels there each Tuesday and returns on Wednesday). She also sells shawls, which she buys in markets in the city of Ayacucho.  Cirila needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy coca leaves and blankets. Cirila dreams of getting ahead in life, of educating her children, and of improving her business. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad. 
Cirila es casada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Cirila vende coca en los pueblos del departamento de la ciudad de Huancavelica a donde viaja semanalmente los días martes y regresa los días miércoles, además vende mantas que compra en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. 
Cirila necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de coca y mantas. 
Cirila sueña con salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy blankets and coca leaves to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Nueva Era (New Era) Village Bank. She is married, has one daughter, and lives in the Magdalena neighborhood of Ayacucho. Ana sells clothing, sheets, blankets, and anything else her clients request. She buys her products in Lima (a 9-hour bus riD. from Ayacucho). She travels to Lima every so often, depending on demand. Ana needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy light jackets, sweaters, and sheets.  Ana’s dreams are to stay healthy and to improve her business.

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era. 
Ana es casada y tiene 1 hija, Ana vive en el Barrio D. la Magdalena, Ana venD. ropa para las diferentes edades, sabanas, frazadas, y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, sus ventas son al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima a donD. viaja dependiendo D. la demanda. 
Ana necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. casacas, chompas y sabanas. 
Los sueños D. Ana son que su negocio mejore y estar bien D. salud.

loans.use: Buy light jackets, sweaters, and sheets

loans.name: Patricia Pilar

texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Lirio (“Iris”) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their 7-year-old child. Patricia studied nursing, but she doesn’t practice. Patricia runs a store in her parents’ house on a busy street in Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables, phone cards, and gifts. She works every day of the week, and her mother helps her run the store. Patricia also works as an administrator for a transport company in her free time.  Patricia needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy toys, fruitcake, and milk for the Christmas season.  Patricia’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build a house on, to buy a car, and to expand her business. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio. 
Patricia es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hijos de 7 de años, de profesión enfermera, Patricia tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres ubicado en una calle concurrida, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, tarjetas telefónicas, regalos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama. Además Patricia en sus momentos libres trabaja como administradora de una empresa de transporte. 
Patricia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes, panetones, leche, para la navidad. 
Los sueños de Patricia son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, comprar un carro y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy toys, fruitcake, and milk for Christmas

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Maria T. R. es propietaria de una pequeña casa, lugar en el cual formó su hogar y su familia, durante muchos años se dedicó a las labores del hogar, pero ante la falta de  ingresos económicos decidió aprovechar una habitación de su casa para instalar una pequeña tienda general de barrio. Actualmente y gracias aq su esfuerzo y su arduó trabajo en la venta, la tienda creció y vende muchos más productos que en un inicio, es por ello que decidió ampliar su tienda, para lo cual necesita materiales de construcción como ser: viguetas prefabricadas, fierro, etc, asi podrá tener mas comodidad. Espera que su negocio siga creciendo, así continuará aportando económicamente en su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Maria T. R. is the owner of a small house, a place in which she has made a home and a family. For many years she worked in the home, but in the face of a lack of income, she decided to take advantage of a room in her house to start a small neighborhood general store. Currently, thanks to her efforts and her hard work in sales, the store has grown and she sells more products now than she did in the beginning. For this reason, she decided to increase the size of her store which is why she needs construction materials like pre-fabricated beams, iron, etc. That way she will be able to be more comfortable. She hopes that her business will keep growing and that she will continue to financially support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Construction Materials to Enlarge her Store

loans.name: Erick Enmanuel
