She has been a FINCA client for 14 years and says that her business is much stronger today thanks to FINCA’s help. She has more customers and dominates more of the local ice cream market. Her goal for the future is to start up another business.

loans.use: Buy milk and food coloring for her ice-cream production

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 54 años, es separada y vive sola. Ella es agricultora, lo cual aprendió desde muy joven e inició su producción hace 40 años. Siendo la agricultura una actividad que le agrada realizar por el contacto que tiene con la naturaleza y por lo libre de presión para  desarrollar su trabajo. Señala también que  las frutas, en especial las naranjas y todo cítrico, es muy solicitado en su zona, ya que la gran mayoría están dedicados a cultivar estos productos y los comerciantes visitan la zona para poder comprar producciones a grandes cantidades. Lo difícil de ser agricultor es estar expuesto al sol todo el día por tener que cuidar tus terrenos de producción y abonarlos. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP y no tuvo problemas de mora en sus pagos anteriormente. Antonia  invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abonos para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 54 years old, separated, and lives alone. She is a farmer, which she learned at a very young age and began her production 40 years ago. Being a farmer is an activity that pleases her because of the contact with nature and the freedom from pressure to develop her work. She also notes that fruit, especially oranges and all citrus, is at a premium in her area since the vast majority of people are dedicated to cultivating these products and the merchants visiting the area buy large quantities. The difficult part of being a farmer is being exposed to the sun all day because she has to care for her lands and fertilize them. This is her second loan with MFP and she had no problems with her earlier payments. Antonia will invest in the purchase of fertilizers for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio tiene 54 años, es casado y vive solo con su esposa. Él es agricultor por más de 40 años, esta actividad lo acompaña desde muy joven y lo que más le agrada realizar es la siembra de piña, ya que es su fruta preferida, además, por ser  un producto de  bastante demanda en los mercados, pero por temporadas logrando ser un producto más rentable, pues son pocos los que  se dedican al cultivo de piña por su zona. Lo difícil de este cultivo es la cosecha, debido a las espinas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Demetrio tiene pensado seguir invirtiendo en la producción de piña, desea adquirir un pequeño terreno más.
texts.en:
Demetrio is 54 years old, married and lives alone with his wife. He has been a farmer for more than 40 years. What he likes most is to plant of pineapple since it is his favorite fruit and it's a product in considerable demand in the markets, but seasons make a product more profitable. In his area, few people are dedicated to the cultivation of pineapple. The difficult thing about this crop is harvesting because of the thorns. This is his first loan with MFP. Demetrio plans to continue investing in the production of pineapple and hopes to acquire another small plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire land to increase his production.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo menor de edad. Ella es agricultora desde hace 30 años, y se dedica por ahora al cultivo de frutas cítricas, actividad que le agrada realizar porque no es muy pesado, sólo se tiene que limpiando los terrenos constantemente y poner trampas para insectos, y así proteger tu producción. Además, los cítricos, en sus temporadas, son muy rentables, ya que los precios de venta suben y esto la favorece y compensan lo difícil de su trabajo, lo cual es la siembra  y la inversión en abonos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Eva tiene pensado invertir en la compra de más naranjales para incrementar su  producción.
texts.en:
Eva is 45 years old, lives with her husband and her young son. She has been a farmer for 30 years, and now cultivates citrus fruits, which she likes because it is not hard work. She only has to clean the grounds regularly and set traps for insects to protect the crop. In addition, citrus, during their season, are very profitable since selling prices go up, which is in her favor and compensates for the difficult part of her work - the investment in seed and fertilizer. This is her first loan with MFP. Eva plans to invest in buying more oranges to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase orange plants.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 43 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de naranjas, actividad que empezó hace 0 años y ahora le agrada realizar. A Fredy le encanta sembrar plantas de naranja, con el tiempo desea poder  incrementar su producción y poder trasladar sus productos a la sierra  y tener mayores ingresos económicos, pero por ahora está esforzándose trabajando en diversas  haciendas, sin descuidar sus propios terrenos de cultivos. Para Fredy lo rentable de sus cultivos es que no requiere de muchos cuidados como otros  productos, pero lo difícil es poder sembrar las plantas de cítricos, es un proceso que requiere de mucha paciencia. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, no ha tenido problemas hasta el momento en  sus pagos. Fredy  invertirá lo solicitado en nuevas plantaciones de cítricos que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. He grows oranges, which he started doing 0 years ago and now he enjoys it. Fredy takes pleasure in planting the orange crops and he would like to increase his production and move his products to the mountains to make more money. Right now he is working at various properties while still paying attention to his own fields. For Fredy, the profitability of the citrus plants does not require much care like other crops, but the difficulty is the patience needed when planting the crops. This is his second loan with MFP; he has not yet had problems with his payments. Fredy will invest the money in new citrus fields that will help him increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fields for citrus fruits

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo tiene 30 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos. Es agricultor,  se dedica a esta actividad por más de 15 años, siendo esta la labor que la agrada realizar, sobre todo porque es una actividad independiente, administrar su producción y trabajar sus tierras le hace sentir  bien.  Cultiva frutos cítricos, se inclinó por estos productos al notar que son muy demandados, además que siempre quiso dedicarse a cultivar  frutas que le agradaran, además las lleva a las ciudades de la sierra para venderlas, donde pagan precios adecuados que recompensan su inversión, lo  difícil es  trasladarlas a estas ciudades, ya que sino se cuenta con un camión, resulta caro el traslado de los productos. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, no tuvo problemas hasta el momento en  sus pagos. Hugo invertirá  el dinero solicitado en la compra de nuevas plantas de cítricos  y de abonos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer that has been enjoyably doing his job for more than 15 years. More than anything, his job is independent: he oversees the production and works the land which makes him feel good. He grows citrus fruits, which he was inclined to grow even though they require much work because he had always wanted to grow a fruit he liked. He brings them to the mountains to sell where the people pay more to compensate for the travel investment. The difficulty is making this extra trouble worthwhile; even with using his van, the products become expensive. This is his second loan with MFP. He has not yet had any problems with his payments. Hugo will invest the money into the purchase of new citrus plants and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new citrus plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Él es agricultor desde hace 30 años, actividad con la cual puede mantener a su familia. Para Juan la cosecha es lo que más le agrada realizar, ya que es menos pesada y mucho más relajante, además, estos productos son muy demandados por temporadas y el producir en mayores cantidades logra que sea más rentable.  Lo difícil es sembrar y cuidar las plantas en sus primeros años de producción para obtener frutos de mayor calidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Juan invertirá lo que solicita en la compra de abonos y plantas de café, producto que se inicia en producir.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and lives with his wife and children. He has been a farmer for the past 30 years and has been able to support his family. According to Juan, the harvest is the most enjoyable because it is less tedious and more relaxing. However, the crops require much work during the seasons and to produce them in large quantities for wholesale distribution is much more profitable. The difficulty is planting the crops and taking care of them in the first years of production to ensure high quality fruit. This is his first loan with MFP. Juan will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and coffee bean plants, a crop that he will start producing.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and coffee bean plants

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer D. 54 años, es separada D. su pareja vive con su hija y sus nietos. Se dedica a la agricultura, actividad en la que se inició desD. que se separo D. su esposo, hace 20 años. María relata que le agrada la agricultura y que junto a su nuera cultivan naranjas, siendo dentro del todo el proceso, la cosecha lo que le agrada realizar, porque todos cooperan para sacar los mejores  frutos D.  su trabajo. Dentro D. lo difícil, para ella, es el sembrado, ya que a su edad no pueD.  realizar trabajos muy forzados y requiere ayuda para ello. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Maria invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra D. abonos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 54 year old woman who is divorced and lives with her daughter and grandchildren. She makes a living through farming, which she has been doing since she separated from her husband 20 years ago. Maria says that she enjoys farming and works together with her daughter in law to grow oranges. Throughout the entire process, the harvest is the most enjoyable part because everyone works together to pick the best fruits from their work. The most difficult part for her is planting the seeds because at her age, she cannot carry out straining tasks and needs help to do them. This is her first loan with MFP. Maria will invest the money in the purchase of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina tiene 29 años, es casada y vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que viene realizando por más de 6 años desde que tuvo su pequeño hijo. Cultivar plátano y yuca lo que más le agrada realizar, ya que ambos productos son de fácil producción, además la demanda y consumo de estos es grande en la selva, el costo en el mercado es bueno, por lo que la venta logra ser rentable y con buenos porcentajes de ganancias. Sin embargo, lo difícil es poder limpiar sus terrenos semanalmente. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Maxinina invertirá el dinero solicitado en la producción de cítricos, la cual quiere iniciar, y tener buenas ganancias para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Maximina is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son. She makes a living by farming, which she has been doing for more than 6 years since her son was little. She likes growing bananas and yucca plants best because they are easy to produce and they are highly demanded and consumed in the forest. The price in the market is good, which makes her sales profitable with a high profit margin. However, the difficulty is clearing her land weekly. This is her first loan with MFP. Maximina will invest the money in the production of citrus plants, which she would like to start growing, and to earn good profits in the next year.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her production of citrus plants

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella es negociante, gracias a que hace 3 años pudo abrir una tienda, logrando con ella, aumentar los ingresos económicos en su hogar. Para Olinda, dedicarse a la venta y a la atención al cliente es lo que más le gusta realizar, ya que se familiariza con sus vecinos, además, dentro de su comunidad es una de las pocas bodegas que existen, esto le favorece, por lo que sus ventas son buenas, y sobre todo, ayudar a las personas a satisfacer sus necesidades en la alimentación es satisfactorio para Olinda. Lo difícil es la compra de su mercadería en la ciudad cercana y el trasladarlo a su comunidad. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, no ha tenido problemas de pago hasta el momento, ha sido responsable y puntual en todas las cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado Olinda tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad y variedad de productos que vende, y tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olinda is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children. She is a business owner because three years ago she was able to open a store, achieving through this an increase in the economic income in her home. For Olinda, working in sales and customer service is what she most likes to do as she gets to know her neighbors. Moreover, within her community it is one of the few stores that exists, and this favors her, which is why her sales are good. Above all, helping people to satisfy their nutritional needs is satisfying for Olinda. The difficult thing is purchasing her merchandise in the nearby city and transporting it to her community. It is her second loan with MFP and she has not had problems with payment to date. She has been responsible and punctual in all of the payments. With the money requested Olinda plans to increase the quantity and variety of the products that she sells and have more to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products in her store

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es: Primitivo tiene 32 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Es agricultor desde hace 20 años, lo cual inicio con el fin de poder mantener su hogar y sobre todo para satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos. Para Primitivo la agricultura es una actividad que le agrada realizar, dentro de ello, el la producción de paltas es lo que más le gusta, ya que es más fácil cultivar estas plantas, y el producto es muy rentable en temporadas, las cuales son anuales, pero  las ganancias son mayores y beneficiosas para todo agricultor, sobre todo cuando los comerciantes compran las producciones por grandes cantidades y se evitas el gasto de tener que trasladar los productos, ya que los propios comerciantes vienen a cosechar y se los llevan por su propia cuenta. Sin embargo, lo difícil es sembrar las plantas de palta,  como también abonar los terrenos para tener una favorable producción. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas en sus pagos, todos han sido puntuales. Primitivo desea invertir el dinero solicitado en mayores cantidades de plantaciones de naranjales.
texts.en:
Primitivo is 32 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and three children. He has been a farmer for the past 20 years, which he began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Primitivo, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, advocado production is what he likes most as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the production in great quantitites and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take them away themselves. However, it is difficult to grow advocado plants as well as fertilize the lands to have a favorable production. It is his second loan with MFP, and to date he has not had problems in his payments as all have been punctual. Primitivo wishes to invest the money requested in greater quantities of orange groves.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Orange Groves

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive con su madre. Es un joven agricultor que se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, con la que se inició para poder ayudar a su madre y crecer económicamente. Dentro de su labor como agricultor, le agrada la cosecha de sus productos, los cuales son en su gran mayoría los cítricos, frutas que son muy solicitadas en los mercados y sobre todo por los comerciantes que  trasportan grandes cantidades para llevarlas a Lima.  Para Roberto lo más difícil es sembrar, limpiar sus terrenos y sobre todo, abonarlos. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, no ha tenido problemas en los meses de pago. Roberto invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de abonos y nuevas plantas de cítricos para iniciar a cultivar nuevas plantaciones de naranjales.
texts.en:
Roberto is 28 years old, single and lives with his mother. He is a young farmer who has dedicated himself to agriculture for the past five years, having started in order to help his mother financially. Within his work as a farmer he enjoys harvesting his products, which are for the most part citrus fruit that are in high demand in the local markets but in particular by the merchants who transport large quantities to Lima. The most difficult part for Roberto is planting and clearing his land but, most of all, fertilizing them. This is his second loan with MFP, and he has not had any problems during his repayment term. Roberto will invest the funds he is requesting into the purchase of fertilizer and new citrus plants to start cultivating new orange groves.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and new plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es: Ronaldo tiene 27 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos con quienes vive. Desde hace 6 años es agricultor, actividad que inició desde que tuvo su primer hijo. Pero siempre le agradó trabajar en el campo, y el producir frutos cítricos ahora, es lo que más le agrada, aunque sus cosechas sean anuales, pero muy rentables, ya que cuando inicia la temporada de naranjas, es muy solicitada esta fruta en grandes cantidades, por ello cuida sus cultivos, para obtener  muy buena cosecha. Menciona también, que lo difícil es sembrar las plantas y cuidarlas de los insectos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Ronaldo  invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de  insecticidas y abonos  para sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Ronaldo is 27 years old, married, and has three children that he lives with. He has been a farmer for six years, an activity he undertook after having his first child. However, he has always taken pleasure from working the land and now particularly enjoys cultivating citrus. Although his crops are annual, they are very profitable, and during the orange season they are very much in demand in large quantities. For this reason, he cares for his crop carefully so he can benefit from a good harvest. He also mentions that it is difficult sowing the plants and protecting them from insect infestation. This is his first loan with MFP. Ronaldo will invest the funds he requests into purchasing insecticides and fertilizers for his farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía  tiene 63 años, es viuda, vive con su hijo de 37 años. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, época en que se casó, comenzó a trabajar en la chacra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Esta actividad le agrada, ya que desde niña aprendió poco a poco la labor, siendo la cosecha lo que más le agrada realizar, ya que no es muy  trabajoso. Además, que  el dedicarse al cultivo de plátanos es rentable, ya que su producción  es quincenal, con lo cual logra obtener cada 1 días ingresos económicos. Lo más difícil es poder  trasladar sus productos a los mercados de la ciudad, ya que el flete es costoso. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Sofía tiene pensado ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo, para  lo cual  requiere la cantidad que solicita para la compra de plantas de  plátano.
texts.en:
Sofia is 63 years old, a widow, and lives with her 37-year old son. She has dedicated herself to farming for the past 40 years, when she married, starting by working on the farm to help her husband with the household expenses. She enjoys this activity, since as a child she learned about it little by little, taking the most pleasure in harvesting her crop. In addition, growing bananas is profitable and produces bimonthly, which allows her to earn money each day. The most difficult part of her enterprise is transporting her product to the city’s markets, since the charters are costly. This is her first loan with MFP. Sofia has thoughts of expanding her farmlands, for which she needs the funds requested to purchase more banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase banana plants.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 60 años, vive con la familia de su hijo y su nieto. Es agricultor por más de 40 años, su mayor ocupación es el cultivo de plátanos y frutos cítricos, los cuales son productos fáciles de sembrar y de rápida producción, por ello que le agrada poder trabajar sembrando estos. También nos mencionó que los plátanos y los cítricos son muy rentables, puesto que la inversión no es muy alta como la del café u otros productos que se cultivan por la zona y su cosecha es anual. Aunque siempre tiene dificultades con los insectos, para lo cual tiene siempre que comprar insecticidas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Víctor  invertirá en la compra de plantas de naranja e insecticidas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Victor is 60 years old, and lives with his son’s family and his grandson. He has been a farmer for more than 40 years, having as his primary occupation the cultivation of bananas and citrus fruits. These are easy to plant and yield produce rapidly, which is why he enjoys being able to work planting these crops. He also mentioned to us that bananas and citrus are very profitable, due to the fact that they don’t require huge investments such as coffee and other products that are grown in the area. In addition, his harvest is annual. However, he always has difficulty with insects for which he must buy insecticides. This is his first loan with MFP. Victor will invest his funds into the purchase of orange plants as well as insecticides for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase orange plants.

loans.name: Migdonia

texts.es: Migdonia tiene 44 años, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos; Henry de 19 años y Yenny de 17. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas, detergentes, aceites, etc., además de variedad de productos comestibles, ella vende en la Mina la Rinconada, donde lleva sus productos, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde aproximadamente, ya que también debe dedicarle tiempo a sus hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edades muy difíciles requiriendo de su guía. El negocio es rentable y lo más difícil para ella es el tener que trabajar en el inclemente frío de la zona en la cual trabaja. Migdonia se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para poder comercializar y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Migdonia is 44 years old, a widow, and lives with her two children: Henry of age 19 and Yenny of age 17. She sells snacks, detergents, oils, etc. She sells her variety of products at la Mina la Rinconada, working from 8:00 in the morning to approximately 3:00 in the afternoon. She also has to spend time with her children because she finds that they need her guidance at their ages. Her business is profitable but the most difficult part is working in the cold climate. Migdonia is taking out her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money, she will purchase a greater quantity of products which she can sell and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise for sale

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeun Y., 56, is the mother of five children; four are married, one is single who carves wood and earns $7 per day. She is a rice farmer in her village in Koktlokle Commune, Siem Reap Province. Her husband, Mr. Lok Thao, 60, is a rice farmer as well, and works with his wife. Khoeun hopes to have oxen to help her plow her farmland and she would like to apply for a loan to buy two oxen. The loan will help her to have additional fixed assets.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Mrs. Hoy V. is 50 years old and makes a living growing rice and vegetables in her village in Koktlokroam Commune, Siem Reap Province. She began her work in 2000 and is the mother of five children; two of her sons are fishermen, two are still young, and the other one is married and lives away home. Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Lach, 48, is a fisherman who catches fish by using traps, nets, and a boat on Tunle Sap Lake. This is the main source of income for covering his family's living expenses. Hoy is applying for a loan for her husband to buy more fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch V., age 65, makes a living by raising female pigs to make piglets to sell for her clients who live near her house or in the area of her Commune. She has five children, four of whom are married, and her son is employed as a fruit seller. Her husband, Mr. Phat Phorn, 58, is a farmer who lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Province. V. needs her son to run a new store for repairing motorcycles. Hence, she applied for a loan to purchase motorcycle materials for her son to work.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle materials

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin V., age 25, is a rice farmer who lives in Kopongkdey Commune in Siem Reap Province. She is the mother of two children who are both still young and go to school. Her husband, Mr. Koch Meung, 32, is a fisherman. He can catch over 20 kg of fish per day to sell for their daily income to sustaining his family's needs, especially to pay for his children's school fees. Koch hopes to purchase more fishing tools, and after discussions with his wife, they decided to apply for a loan to purchase more nets, and traps for catching fish.

loans.use: To purchase more nets, and traps

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Mrs. Tim T. is 41 years old and makes a living growing rice and vegetables, a business she started in 1982. She lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Province, and has three young children who live at home. Her husband, Mr. Lai Thong, age 36, is a rice farmer and works with his wife. The couple can earn approximately $2 per day. Tim requests a loan to buy two oxen to help her plow a field. The loan will allow her to increase her rice yield so that it is higher than the previous year.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Yi H., age 36, has two children who are both still young and attend school. She is a rice and vegetable farmer, who grows cabbages, morning glory, and water lily. This provides the main source for covering her family's living. Her husband, Mr. Horm Thorn, 42, is a rice farmer and also works with her. To alleviate some of the hard work, Yi would like to ask for a loan to purchase two oxen, and a cow-cart to help her business. The family lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen, and a cow-cart

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em H. is 30 years old and makes a living raising pigs at her home, which she sells to a slaughterer six months after raising them. She lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Provice, and has one young child. Her husband, Mr. Vorn Paiy, age 33, is a local farmer. Em needs to ask for a loan to purchase two oxen for her husband to plow a field, and four piglets to raise. (She and her husband are in the picture.)

loans.use: To purchase two oxen, and four piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Sreymom Suong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of twenty two people, is located in Rom Lech Village in Kampong Cham Province.  All the members in this village bank will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sreymom S. is a village bank president.  She is a farmer wH. owns a 1-hectare field for cultivating rice for a living.  Since her field is far from irrigation, it is difficult to generate water for her field.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fuel to support her pump to water her field and make her crop more productive.  Her husband, Mr. T. Hao, is a village chef wH. makes a small salary to help support the household.  

Mrs. Sreymom S. is 48 years old and the mother of five children; one of whom is a car repairer, while another one helps their mother on rice field.  The remaining three are attending the local school.  

All the members are shown in the picture but two are partially blocked from view.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These seven are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fuel to support her pump to water her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea D., 22, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Din, 32, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young and stay at home.

Sophea has been selling grocery items for four months. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for four years, a skill he learned from a fellow villager. He buys additional construction tools from Phnom Penh. The couple is in the process of building their own house and lacks the money to buy wood to finish it.

Therefore, Sophea is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood and construction materials to finish her new house.

loans.use: To purchase wood and construction materials to finish their new house.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Mr. Sour S., 63, and his wife, Mrs. Un Mao, 61, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1964 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other son is a construction worker and weaves silk when he is free from construction work.

Sour has been a wooden house builder since he was sixteen years old, a skill he learned from his father. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was ten years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sour is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim U., 50, and her husband, Mr. PhU. Morm, 54, have been married for over twenty years and have two daughters. Both of them are garment factory workers. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sim is a full-time employee repairing fishing nets. Her husband has been a fisherman for over twenty years. He catches fish from the Tonle Sap River and sells the fish in the village.

Sim is requesting a loan of US$ 250 to level the foundation of her house.

loans.use: To level the foundation of her house

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok P., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyneang Roeun, 28, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They married in 2001 and have three daughters.

Sok has been a motor taxi ("Tuk Tuk") driver for two years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for one year. He is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to build a staircase and purchase wood to build the walls of his house.

loans.use: To build a staircase and purchase wood  to build walls for house

loans.name: Khoek

texts.en: Mrs. Khoek S. lives in Koktlokroam Commune in Siem Reap Province, is 29 years old, and has two young children. She is a farmer and specializes in growing rice, to pay for their daily living expenses. Her husband, Mr. Chhem Lon, age 26, is a fisherman, and also raises fish in a local pond near his house in his village. Khoek needs to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to make transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to make transportation easier

loans.name: Fátima Vicente

texts.pt:
Fátima Vicente M. is from Maputo, 39 years old, separated and the mother of 3 children who all attend school - the oldest is 16, the second oldest is 12 and the youngest is 9. She supports only her children.

Fátima was in school until the 8th grade and she stopped studying when she landed a contract to go and work in what used to be the RDA (Democratic Republic of Germany). She remained there for two years and when she returned, she married the father of her children; a marriage which lasted only 14 years.

Fátima is a trader and business owner and sells necessary (staple) items and various drinks. She does this alone as she has no employees and her establishment opens at 8am and closes at 8pm. Her monthly income from this business is 2250 MZN and she lives in her own home.

This is Fátima’s first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She intends to repay her loan early in order to request another one to improve her house and later buy a vehicle to aid her in her business.

Translated from Portuguese, Brazil by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

Fátima Vicente M. é natural de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 3 filhos todos estudantes com idade entre o primeiro com16 anos, o segundo com 12 anos e o terceiro com 9 anos de idade respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Fátima estudou até 8ªclasse e parou quando conseguiu contrato para ir trabalhar na Alemanha antiga RDA, onde por lá esteve por dois anos, no seu regresso juntou se com o pais dos seus filhos casamento que durou apenas 14 anos.

Fátima é negociante e dona do negocio, o qual consiste na venda de produtos da primeira necessidade e bebidas diversas. Faz sozinha não tem empregada, com um estabelecimento que abre as 8:30 e fecha as 20:00h, com este negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 2250 mt, vive numa casa própria.

Para Fátima este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva e pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim melhorar a sua casa e posterior comprar uma viatura para ajudar lhe no seu negocio.

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Mariana Mahota

texts.pt:
Mariana M. é natural da cidade de Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, é casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idades entre o primeiro tem 10 anos e estuda na 5ªclasse, o segundo tem 8 anos e estuda na 3ªclasse e o terceiro com 2 anos. Para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Mariana estudou até 7ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras, aos 25 anos se casou, neste mesmo ano inicia um negocio de vende de gado bovino para matadouros da cidade de Maputo, em 2005 deixa este tipo de negocio onde alega que para conseguir gado tinha que viajar muito sem ninguém para cuidar dos filhos, assim começa a venda de produtos congelados (Carne, Chouriço, iogurte eito). Com este negócio tem um rendimento mensal de 12000,00mt e consegue poupar 3500,00mt.

Mariana pede empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, conheceu a através de amigas que são clientes a bastante tempo.  Com o empréstimo pretende ampliar os seus produtos para poder responder a demanda cada vez crescente dos seus clientes.

Mariana tem como maior desafio fazer uma barraca na sua casa para venda dos seus produtos, o seu objectivo daqui para frente e de trabalhar mais para tornar o seu negocio mais rentável e poder realizar o sonho de ter uma loja para venda de produtos alimentares
texts.en:
Mariana M. is from the city of Maputo. She's thirty-six years old, married, and the mother of three children. The first is ten and in fifth grade, the second is eight and in third grade, and the third is two years old. Besides her kids she supports her mother, sending her money monthly. Mariana studied until seventh grade and didn't continue because they didn't have the financial means. When she was twenty-five she got married, and in the same year started a business selling cattle to the slaughterhouses of Maputo. In 2005 she left this type of business, because she says to procure the cattle she had to travel a lot, without anyone to take care of her children. This is how she came to sell frozen foods (meat, sausage, yogurt). With this business, she has a monthly income of 12000 meticais and manages to save 3500. Mariana is applying for her first loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. She heard of it through friends who have been long-time clients. With this loan, she plans to increase her stock to be able to respond to the ever-growing demand from her clients. Mariana's biggest challenge is to build a small store at her house for the sale of her products. Her objective going forward is to work to make her business more profitable and to be able to accomplish her dream of having a store for selling food products.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling frozen foods

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem N., age 26, is the mother of one young child, and lives in Lvengresey Commune in Siem Reap Province. She makes a living by raising ducks for sale, and currently earns $5 each day, while her husband, Mr. Koun Song, 26, is a local farmer and also helps with his wife's work. Sem hopes to improve her business, and is seeking a loan to buy more ducks to raise, and feed for fattening her ducks.

loans.use: To buy more ducks, and duck feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria nasceu em inhambane, tem 55 anos de idade não teve a oportunidade de ir a escola devido a falta de condicoes dos seus progenitores.é casada  e mae de 8 filhos com idades compriendida entre os 25 aos 45 anos de idade todos eles são casados. 

Maria sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia                                                   com seu esposo em emisao de servico, este que era policia civil. Chegado a namaacha comeca a trabalhar em macuacua uma localidade do mesmo distrito, entao ela decide criar galinhas do mato  pois a zona era muito adequada para pratica dessa actividade e revendia-os na vila. com o fundo colectado e com ajuda do seu esposo compram um carro que os permitiu mais ainda expandir o seu negocio, para alem dos frangos passa tambem a vender carvao na cidade de maputo. Mas devido a guerra maria perde todos seus bens e muda se para a vila onde continua com a sua actividade  mais com muita dificuldade. Hoje cria galinhas cafriais em sua casa tem comprado no maximo 2x100 caixas de pintos a 14.000.00mt e revende cada a 85.00mt tem tido um lucro de 3.000.00mt mensalmente e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00mt porque tem que pagar dispesas dos seus netos que emcontram se a estudar.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de maria na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva.o primeiro de 8.000.00mt usou para comprar pintos, conseguiu pagar sem nenhuma dificuldade e pede este segundo de 10.000.00mt para reforcar o eu negocio. Esta cofiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir outro emprestimo para reabilitar a sua barraca
texts.en:
Maria was born in Inhambane. She's 55 years old and didn't have the opportunity to go to school because her parents could not afford it. She is married and the mother of eight children between 25 and 45 years old, all married. Maria left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the frontier with Swaziland, with her husband who was in the service of the civil police. Once in Namaacha, she started working in Macuacua, a place in the same district. She decided to raise guinea fowl, as this is an appropriate zone for this activity, and to sell them in town. With the funds she made, and with the help of her husband, they bought a car, which allowed them to expand their business even further. Besides chickens, they also began to sell charcoal in the city of Maputo. But because of the war, Maria lost all her goods and moved to town, where she continues her enterprise, but with a lot of difficulty. Today she raises chickens at home. She has bought at most 2 x 100 cases of chicks at 14000 meticais and resold each at 85 meticais. She has had a profit of 3000 meticais monthly and manages to save 1000 per month, because she has to pay the expenses of her grandchildren, who are in school. This is the second of Maria's loans with Hluvuku, and the first with Kiva. The first, of 8000 meticais, she used to buy chicks. She was able to repay it without a single difficulty and now is applying for this second one of 10000 meticais to strengthen her business. She's confident that she will repay ahead of time and request another loan to renovate her stall.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Rubina Peter Bota Group

texts.en:
Rubina Baji is a 39-year-old lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 13 years. She is an educated lady. She is doing a job in a private hospital as a nurse. Her husband's name is P. B.. He is a cook by profession. He has a food business where he sells a Punjabi dish (Daal Chawal). He has been in this business for the past 15 years.  Rubina Baji has three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in 5th standard. Her elder daughter is in 7th standard and her younger daughter is in 4th standard. Rubina Baji is applying for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, spices and rice) for her husband’s food business. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rozi Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. Nasreen Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Sonia Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Samina I. Baji wants a loan to buy a furniture polisher for her furniture polish business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her food business

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn S., 48, is a widow with three children: two sons and a daughter. One of them is married and lives outside the family house and the other two children study in a local school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Simorn has been selling vegetables and chickens for one year. She bought them from her fellow villagers for sale at Ta Khmao market. She is requesting a loan of US$1200 to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables and chickens for sale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and chicken for sale.

loans.name: Seema Sultan Masih Group

texts.en:
Seema baji is a widow of S. M. and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son is a cook by profession and makes food on order. Her daughter stays at home and makes embroidered dresses. Seema baji runs a beauty parlor at home. She started a beauty parlor after the death of her husband and became the only breadwinner of her family. She took her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and invested the amount in her beauty parlor. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more material (cosmetics, creams) for her beauty parlor. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy paints for her paint business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a furniture polisher for her furniture polish business. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy material (cosmetics and creams) for her beauty parlor. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her beauty salon

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mr. Ven K. is 45 years old, and is a local carpenter who makes furniture such as tables, chairs, beds, and cupboards for sale. He currently has an income of $4 per day, which is the main source for covering his family's expenses. His wife, Mrs. Chorn Ronn, age 39, sells groceries, and also raises pigs from her home. They have six children, one of whom is employed. Ven is applying for a loan to buy a wood scraping machine to help in his work. The family live in Koktlokroam Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a wood scraping machine

loans.name: Nasreen Parvaiz Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a wife of P. A. and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 11 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen baji’s husband is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has experience of 8 years. Nasreen baji herself makes embroidered dresses and stitches clothes. She charges $2 for stitching and $4 for embroidereing dress. She is applying for a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani B. baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Malka baji wants a loan to buy material (utensils, table covers and chairs) for her catering business. Saba baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Razia baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Urfa Yousaf Masih Group

texts.en:
Urfa baji is a 54-year-old lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the past 2 years. Her husband's name is Y. M., and he is a mason by profession. Urfa baji has no kids. She keeps herself busy making embroidered dresses. First she did this work to keep herself busy but now she chooses this activity as a profession. She charge fees per embroidered dress and her fees for each dress is $3. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy mason tools for her husband.  

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy material (beams and ropes) for her shuttering business. Zuhra baji wants a loan to buy another bike for her rented motor bike business. Dorus baji wants a loan to buy furniture (chairs and tables) for her tuition center. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy mason tools

loans.name: Rukhsana Asif Gull Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a 45 year-old-lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She works as a teacher in a local school after completing her education till 10th standard. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son works in a private office. Her elder daughter works in a private hospital and her younger daughter is in 7th standard. Her husband's name is A. G., and he has a business repairing computers. Rukhsana baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy tools for her husband. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Shazia sadiq baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, sketches and colored thread) for her boutique. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. Reeta baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy tools to repair computers

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun N., 25, and her husband married in early 2008. She has four siblings and lives with her parents, brothers and sister on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Savun has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her aunt, since she was sixteen years old. Besides weaving, she also has started to buy silk fabric from her fellow villagers for resale in another province. Her husband is a mason. 

Savun is requesting a loan of 300 to purchase silk fabric for resale and buy fertilizer for her father growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabric for resale and buy fertilizer for her father growing rice.

loans.name: Samina Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Samina baji is 30-year-old lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 15 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Samina baji’s husband's name is N., and he is a mason. Samina baji runs a grocery shop in her house. She is running this shop to meet household expenses, because in Pakistan inflation is increasing rapidly and it’s difficult for one person to meet the house's expenses. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shazia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Joshphen baji wants a loan to buy tools for her mobile phone repair shop. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhem K., is a rice farmer, and is aged 36. She lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Province and has seven children, two of whom are married and live away from home, and one is a fisherman who makes a profit of $5 per day. She is married to Mr. Sham Nhang, 44, a fisherman, who fishes in Tunle Sap Lake, and has been in this business since 2001. Chhem seeks a loan to purchase planks for her house. (Mrs. Chhem's husband in the picture because she was not available that day.)

loans.use: To purchase planks for her house

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeang M., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sony Noem, 45, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have three children: one son and two daughters. The children all study in local school. 

Mrs. Yeang has been a tailor since 1990, a skill she learned from her teacher in Phnom Penh. She bought a sewing machine and cloth from Phnom Penh in order to run a tailoring business at her house. Her husband is a mason in the village and in a nearby province. Yeang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one more sewing machine and additional cloth for expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth for sale.

loans.name: Naret

texts.en:
Mrs. Naret K., 24, and her husband, Mr. Phoun Sok, 22, who live along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and have one daughter. The couple lives with Naret’s mother.
 
Naret has been selling grocery items for four years. She buys grocery items from Koki market for resale at her village and she also raises pigs. Her husband has been a mason for three years. Naret is requesting a loan to purchase piglets to raise and some amount for buying grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T., 45, and her husband, Mr. Vit Ses, 47, live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family house, one child is a garment factory worker and other three children stay at home.

Sokha has been selling porridge and Cambodian cake for seven years. She buys meat and ingredient from Koki market to cook and sell in front of her house. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for twenty years. He drives people from his village to Koki market. Sokha and her family members live in an old house some part of which is broken (see the picture) but the couple lacks the money to repair it. Therefore, Sokha is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en:
Mrs. Teng S., 54, and her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Mom, 58, who live about 17 miles from Phom Penh, have three sons and two daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, one child has full time employment and the other child is a farmer.

Teng and her husband have been farming since they were married. They grow rice and many types of vegetables on their farmland in the village. Now Teng is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this loan to purchase a water pump, rice seed, pesticides and fertilizer for the rice and vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, rice seed, pesticides, and fertilizer for growing rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Nhen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of fifteen people, is located in Pun Phnum Village in Takeo Province.  Mrs. M. Nhen is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.  

She was born in 1978.  She is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living.  On this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil, which affects her crop badly, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field, and make her crop more productive.  Her husband, Mr. Lay T., helps her on the plantation.  Mrs. M. Nhen has two children who are both too young to work or study because they are at the ages of one and four years old.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These nine are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N., 44, and her husband, Mr. Savat Miech, 46, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have three sons. One of their children is learning tailoring, another son attends school, and the youngest son is still at home.

Mom and her husband have been selling grocery items for two years. They buy them from Koki market for resale at their house. Mom is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to purchase grocery items for resale and to buy a sewing machine for her son.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mr. Sam S., age 48, is a widower, and lives in Lvengreusey Commune, Siem Reap Province. He is a rice farmer who has three children; one is married, and one daughter, Ms. S. Ny, 20, works together with her father. To earn additional income, Sam would like to ask for a loan to purchase small ducks to raise, and also purchase feed for them. The loan will increase his family income and help to cover his whole family's expenses and provide more stability. (Mr. Sam's daughter is pictured because he was not available at the time.)

loans.use: To purchase small ducks to raise

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Mr. Born P., 61, and his wife, Mrs. Kimyun Ly, 55, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1974 and have nine children; two sons and seven daughters. Two sons are married and live outside the family house, two children are farmers,  two children sell clothes, two children stay at home, and the last child studies in the local school.

Mr. Born and his wife have been farming for twenty-eight years. They grow rice and cucumbers on their farmland near the village. Now Born is applying a loan of $ 1000 to use for growing rice and cucumbers.

loans.use: To use for growing rice and cucumbers.

loans.name: Mrs. Phal Saing Villag Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who all live in Pun Phnum Village in Takeo Province make up the village bank loan.  All the members will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes.  

Mrs. Phal S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She and her husband, Mr. On Hol, own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for livI..  They have seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of five years old.  

Although Mrs. Phal S. and her family have different businesses, they still cannot provide better conditions for the family.  In order to improve these livI. conditions, Mrs. Phal S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to bU. a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi drivI. business.  She hopes to improve her livI. conditions with this new loan. 

This is a village bank loan consistI. of mainly end-of-term loans.  Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These nine are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi driving business.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheang S., 33, and her husband, Mr. Neang Ny, 32,  live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and the other one is still young and stays at home.

Sokheang has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village who then takes it to sell at the Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Neang, has been selling pigs for ten years. He buys them at one village for resale at another village.

Sokheang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy pigs for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy pigs for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokny Toeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people, who are living in Trapeang Ronoung Village in Takeo Province, form the village bank loan.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sokny T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She is a farmer and pig breeder.  Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to by more piglets for breeding.  She hopes to increase her income through this loan.  Her husband, Mr. Suon Samnang, is an electrician who can earn a small salary to support the household.  Mrs. Sokny T. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are both staying at home because they are at the ages of two and four years old.
 
All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans, which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To by more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal P. is a group leader of four people who live in Slaeng Village in Kandal Province.  

Mrs. Sophal P. is a farmer who has 1-hectar of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  On this plantation, she now faces a small problem because of her infertile soil.  In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.  Her husband, Mr. Bich Bo, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm wine and sugar.  

Mrs. Sophal P. is 48 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the one other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim H. is a villager in Trouy Troeng Village in Kandal Province.  She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family.  Her husband, Mr. Pok Phal, is a blacksmith who makes doors and windows by using steel.  Since the business is going well, he needs more material in order to reach his customers’ demands.  So, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy steel for her husband's business.  

Mrs. Khim H. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are both staying at home because they are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy steel for her husband's business.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mr. Pha N. was born in 1970 and she now lives in Lvea Sar Kandal village in Kandal province.  He and his wife, Mrs. Phat Yoeurn, have 1.25-hectares of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  

On this plantation, they now cannot cultivate rice because they have insufficient rice seeds to cultivate.  To deal with this purpose, Mr. Pha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to plant.  He would use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support the field and make a better crop.  

Mr. Pha N. has six children, four of whom are attending the local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the ages of one month and four years old.  His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to plant.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support the field and make a better crop.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. is a villager in Sromouch Nor village in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  

She is 47 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a taxi driver, while the youngest one is attending the local school.  Although she and her children have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well.  So, Mrs. Touch P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.  She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions after she sells her cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim S. was born in Svay Prey Village in Kampong Cham Province.  She is a breeder who raises pigs and ducklings.  

Since the first business is going well, she wants to expand it.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets for breeding.  She would use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for her pigs.  Her husband, Mr. Pol Pin, is a farmer who owns 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  

Mrs. Yim S. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker, while two others are attending the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old.  Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for breeding.  She will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for her pigs.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Mrs. Rem Y. is a villager in Moat Boeung village in Kandal province.  She is a broom seller in the local market.  Her husband, Mr. Khem Khorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  He does not own a pair of oxen to plow his field, so he usually pays much money for plowing.  In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Rem Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to his old one for plowing. 

She is 59 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in garment factory.  Her husband is also shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an ox to add to his old one for plowing.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna M. lives in Boeung Kor Ek Villge in Kandal Province.  She is employed in a garment factory.  She is a 37 year old widow with one child who is attending the local school.  She is able to make a small salary, which makes it very difficult to provide a better life for her family.  

To improve her living conditions, Mrs. Vanna M. decided to ask for a loan, which she will add to her savings so that she can buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To add to her savings so that she can buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin S. is a villager in Neil Village in Takeo Province.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  What he can earn through his cultivation is less than what he needs to povide for his household expanses.  

His wife, Mrs. Khat Khem, is a housewife and she now wants to breed pigs.  Thus, Mr. Sarin S. decided to request a loan to buy seven piglets to start a breeding business.  He would use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for them. He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. 

He is 47 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school.  His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy seven piglets to start a breeding business.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for them.

loans.name: Suzzy

texts.en:
Suzzy O. is 42 years old and is married with five children. Suzzy sells drinks and provisions. She is able to support her family from the small profits she makes from the business.

Suzzy hopes to expand her business, and needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She would like to thank everyone that has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Last year, Gloria M. decided to become a rice retailer in her community.  She is happily married and blessed with three children, two of whom are already in college.  They live in a community that has always been recognized for its clean and green program by the LGU (Local Government Unit).  

She sells affordable rice, but there have been times when she has run out of stocks because of the increasing demand of her customers. To solve this dilemma, she has decided to borrow P5,000 to purchase more sacks of rice.

She hopes that her loan request will be granted, because the additional rice that she can buy with this amount will, indeed, give her more income, which can greatly help her children’s education.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun K. is a farmer in Neil village in TaK. Province.  She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  

On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil, affects her crop badly.  In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive. 

Mrs. Moeun K. is a 49-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is a worker, and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget J. is 40 years old and is married with four children. Bridget sells second hand clothes for both men and women. She purchases the second hand clothes from Lagos State to sell in Benin City. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist.

Bridget needs a loan in the amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more second hand clothes to sell to those that cannot afford new clothes. She would like to thank everyone that has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther I. is 42 years old and is married with five children. Esther purchases drinks from distributors to sell. She is happy because the festive season will make demand for her drinks to increase.

Esther needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She would like to express her gratititude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun N. is a villager in Sean Born Village in Takeo Province.  She and her husband, Mr. Ngen Kun, sell Chinese noodles in the local market.  

In their business, they face an obstacle because they usually pay much money for transportation.  In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Samoeun N. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase a motorbike.  She hopes to reduce her expenses and provide a better life for her family. 

She is 33 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.  Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris E. is 26 years old and is married with two children. Doris lives with her family in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Doris sells drinks and snacks, and also sachets of water. This is the festive season and she hopes to make additional sales during this season.

Doris needs a loan in the amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She wants to express her gratitude to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers polygames à Banankabougou un des quartiers de la sous-préfecture de Ouelessebougou (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariage, de parenté et de voisinage. Elles exercent toutes le commerce d’articles divers.
Dans leur recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elles décidèrent de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec lequel  elles sont à leur premier prêt.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 500  kilogrammes de céréales, 300  kilogrammes de fruits et une importante quantité de produits de beauté. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place au marché de Ouelessebougou auprès de grossistes et vendent sur place essentiellement en détail et au comptant à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les interêt du prêt et investir le reste dans les  activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 3 children. They live in polygamous households in Banankabougou, a district of the sous-prefecture of Ouelessebougou (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know each other because of ties of marriage, kinship, and neighborhood. They all sell various items. In their search for complementary financial resources they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first loan.

With this loan they intend to buy 500 kg of cereals, 300 kg of fruits, and a lot of beauty products. They do their buying in the market of Ouelessebougou from wholesalers, and they re-sell right where they live, essentially retail and for cash, to a clientele made up mostly of women.

They hope to make an average monthly profit of 22,000 F CFA which they will use to make repayments on the loan, investing the remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals, fruit, condiments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Mrs. Vanny S. is a villager in Ang Doung village in Kandal Province. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a driver in the company. The others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Sun Phang, is a fisherman. Mrs. Vanny S. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. In the plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have rice seed and she needs to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. To solve these problems, she decided to ask for a loan and she would use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Khann

texts.en: Mrs. Khann N. is 23 years old and now lives in Phngas village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Keim Chan Noeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He now faces an obstacle because his field is infertile which will have a bad effect on his crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Khann N. decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field and she would use the rest of loan to buy duck food for her breeding business. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support the field and to buy duck food for her breeding business.

loans.name: Dim

texts.en: Mr. Dim P. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chan Yan, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They earn less income than they need to support their household. Thus, Mr. Dim P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to reduce his expense for plowing. He hopes to increase income and provide a better life for his family. He is 50 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Siguidja Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SIGUIDJA sont des femmes mariées qui vivent dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne 39 ans et 5  enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens d’amitié et de famille et résident toutes dans la sous- préfecture de Ouéléssébougou située à 80  kilomètres de Bamako capitale du Mali (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ce groupe s’est spécialisé dans la fabrication et la vente du Sounbala un produit alimentaire très apprécié et recherché pour la préparation des sauces en Afrique de l’ouest. Elles ont appris la fabrication du Sounbala dès le bas âge auprès de leurs mères c'est-à-dire  une somme de connaissance séculaire transmise de génération en génération. En effet les grains néré une fois proprement lavés, sont bouillies, pilés et ensuite pétries afin d’avoir la pâte alimentaire noirâtre appelée SOUNBALA à laquelle plusieurs formes sont données. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
