Comenta que todo ha transcurrido tranquilamente en su vida y que ha tenido como logro la satisfacción D. ver a sus hijos mayores y trabajando, Juana venD. especerías en el Jr. Hualcán, cerca al jardín D. niños D. Huarupampa, negocio que ha crecido poco a poco, menciona que ella empezó con s/.3.00 y actualmente invierte diariamente un promedio D. s/.150.00 en sus molidos, Juana compra sus insumos D. los mayoristas que vienen  D. la zona costa.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra D. 19 sacos D. maní y con el saldo comprará ají.
 
A Juana le es importante trabajar porque afirma que todavía debe seguir adelante por sus nietos.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank called “Señor Del Cautivo II” in the district of Independencia in the city of Huaraz in the state of Ancash. She's 64 years old and has 5 adult children who no longer depend on her financially, but she and her husband support their grand-children. She tells us that she's had a good and quiet life and she has had the satisfaction to see her kids grow up and find good jobs. Juana sells spices in the area of Jr. Hualcan close to the children's park in Huarupampa. Her business has been growing little by little. She tells us that she began with little money and now she makes a good profit. Juana buys her ingredients from the vendors that come to her area who sell at whole price. With this loan, which she will repay within 8 months, she will purchase 19 sacks of mani and with the earnings she will purchase aji ( a Peruvian hot pepper). Juana thinks it's important for her to continue working in order to support her grand-children.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 19 sacks of Mani and Aji (Peruvian spices)

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "RAYITO DE L." ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA JUDITH NANCY ELLA ES MADRE DE FAMILIA Y RESIDE EN EL MISMO BARRIO QUE LAS DE MAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y CON MUCHAS GANAS DE TRABAJAR EN SUS PUESTO DE VENTA DE COMIDA,  COSMÉTICOS, MINERALES Y BEBIDAS EN GENERAL. ELLAS SABEN QUE DE SU TRABAJO DEPENDE SU FAMILIA POR ESO SE DEDICAN MUCHO A CAPTAR CLIENTES PARA SUS PEQUEÑAS PENSIONES Y PUESTOS DE COMIDA. EL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE SUS PUESTOS DE TRABAJO Y AL INCREMENTO DE INSUMOS Y MATERIALES A LA VENTA. ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE TRABAJA CON LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL PERO CONOCEN DE LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE IMPLICA UN CRÉDITO EN ESPECIAL CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS, ALGUNAS COMENTAN QUE YA TRABAJARON EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS Y SON CAPACES DE CUMPLIR CON ESTA RESPONSABILIDAD ES POR ESO QUE LA FUNDACIÓN ACEPTÓ DARLE UNA OPORTUNIDAD PARA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE LAS FAMILIAS DE LAS SOCIAS.
texts.en:
The group called "Rayito de L." (little moon ray) is represented by Judith Nancy. She's a mother and lives in the same barrio (neighborhood) as the other members of the group. They are all resposible people with a lot of energy to work either at the food stand, selling beauty products, selling refreshments, and so forth. They know that their families depend on them to make a living. This is why they work hard on attracting as many clients as they can to their individual businesses. This loan will help them in purchasing more ingredients and more merchandise for their individual businesses and also to make any neccesary improvements. This is their first time working with the foundation Agrocapital, but they realize that it's a big responsability in order to pay this loan off. Various members tell us that they have worked with other financial institutions in the past, and they know they can fulfill this responsability. This is why the creditor or foundation agreed in giving them an opportunity in order for the members to better their standards of living.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline sells ice and dried fish. The demand for her ice and dried fish are high. She sells from Mondays to Sundays. Roseline is 40 years old and married with six children. Roseline is a LAPO client. She lives in Issashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more ice and dried fish to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase ice and dried fish

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their four children. She and her husband sell construction materials like sand, stones and bricks, which they deliver to customers’ homes and workplaces. Roberta also has two rented spaces where she stores her products. Roberta is requesting a loan to buy sand and stones.  Roberta’s dreams are to educate her children and to own a car to transport her wares.

loans.use: To buy sand and stones

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Fermina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito D. Independencia, provincia D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Fermina ya no se hace cargo D. sus 5 hijos. A sus 65 años comenta que no ha tenido problemas difíciles en su vida, que su logro más granD. ha sido ver, junto a su esposo, a sus hijos crecer y el poder educarlos para que sean profesionales. En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cerdos en las afueras D. la ciudad D. Huaraz. Compra los deshechos D. los restaurantes mezclándolos con el afrecho y cebada molida. VenD. los cerdos vivos a las mujeres que venden cerdos asados en las plazuelas D. la ciudad y también venD. la carne a pedido.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra D. afrecho para reserva y pagará por adelantado a los restaurantes para el abastecimiento D. deshechos, ya que paga por cada balD. S/. 3.00. 

Fermina afirma que le encantaría capacitarse para su desarrollo personal porque es tiempo D. descansar del trabajo.
texts.en:
Fermina belongs to the community bank of Senor del Cautivo II at the Independence district, department of Ancash. Fermina doesn’t support her 5 children anymore, as they are all adults now. She is 65 years old and she says her biggest achievement has been to see together with her husband her children grow and educate them to be professionals. Currently she rises and sells pigs outsiD. the city of Huraz. She also buys leftovers from restaurants and mixes it with other ingredients to feed the pigs. She sells the pigs alive to the women who sell barbeque pork in the city and she also sells meat under request. With the S/.1,200 which will be paid in 8 quotes, she will buy leftovers to store and will pay in advance because currently she pays S/. 3.00 per bucket. Fermina would love to study to improver her personal development because is time to rest from work.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy in advance leftovers from restaurants

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana sells foodstuffs and sachet water. She has been in this business since the year 2002. Juliana needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more frozen foods like chicken and turkey to sell. She is happy because the festive season will attract more customers to her store and she hopes to make more profits.

Juliana is a LAPO client. She and her family live in Issashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Dalila Guadalupe

texts.es:
Dalila forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” del distrito de Pariahuanca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Dalila tiene 36 años de edad y es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Afirma que aún cuando su principal dificultad ha sido que el padre de sus hijos no haya asumido sus responsabilidades, ha seguido adelante junto a sus pequeños a quienes considera sus tesoros. En la actualidad tiene el negocio de venta de alimentos en un pequeño restaurante que inició hace 6 meses en su casa y con el apoyo de su hermano ha podido tener clientes, en especial los turistas en temporada alta. Se abastece de los animales que cría en su casa y las verduras que siembra, así mismo compra los otros productos que necesita en la ciudad de Huaraz. También comenta que su principal dificultad es que la afluencia de turistas sólo es por temporadas y que tendrá que enfrentar la temporada baja con la venta de animales menores. Se encuentra a gusto con este trabajo y desea seguir creciendo.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de gallinas y cuyes.
 
Dalila afirma que le gustaría aprender para mejorar su negocio y criar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dalila belongs to the community bank of Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II from the Pariahuanca district, department of Ancash. Dalila is 36 years old and is a single mother of 2 children. Currently she sells meals on a little restaurant that started 6 months ago at her house with the support of her brother, her biggest clients are tourist during high season. She gets supplies from the animals she raises at home and vegetables she harvest from her garden and some products she buys in the city of Huaraz. Her biggest difficulty is that tourism is a seasonal business so during low season she has to sell smaller animals. She wants to keep on growing her business. With the loan of s/.500 which will be paid in 8 quotes, she will buy chickens and cuyes. She wants to study to improve her business and raise her children.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará gallinas y cuyes.

loans.name: San Felipe Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Felipe” esta representado por la señora Maura, en general los integrantes del grupos se dedican al comercio de prendas de vestir, cosméticos, masitas, abarrotes y algunos se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir y mascaras o caretas. Son gente responsable como lo demostraron en anteriores ciclos. Ellas saben que el trabajo en el mercado tiene mucha competencia pero tienen años de experiencia trabajando en el rubro y conocen la modalidad del mercado de la oferta y la demanda. El destino del financiamiento es para incrementar su mercadería así como a la compra de herramientas de trabajo para mejorar sus pequeñas tiendas ya que la época navideña existe más posibilidad para incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The group “San Felipe” is represented by Mrs. Maura. In general the members of this group work selling clothes, make up, groceries and some work sawing clothes and creating masks. They are all very responsible people as proven before. They know that work on the market has lots of competition, but they have years of experience working on it and know supply and demand principles. They will use the loan to increase their inventory to be ready for the holiday season, when they hope they will increase sales and their income to help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fausat

texts.en: Fausat sells gallons of vegetable and palm oil. She sells in wholesale and retail to her customers. Fausat has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Badagry, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. Fausat is 37 years old and married with 4 children. Fausat needs a loan in the amount of N 100, 000 to purchase more palm and vegetable oil to sell. She is grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm and vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Kindness

texts.en: Kindness is 23 years old and married without a child. Kindness sells clothes like skirts, trousers, shirts, etc. She is a LAPO client. The demands for her clothes are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more skirts, shirts and trousers to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en: Maria Luz is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank.  Maria Luz is 38 years old and separated with two children. Maria Luz sells bricks and other construction materials. She sells from her home and also makes home deliveries in a rented vehicle. She often fires the bricks herself in a rented oven. Maria Luz is requesting a loan to buy sand and bricks.  Maria Luz’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her businesses.

loans.use: To buy sand and bricks

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. She is 19 years old and she lives with her partner and their daughter. Ruth has a small grocery store in her house in the Covadonga neighborhood where she works each day selling dry goods, vegetables, and fruits. Ruth also travels to the jungle regions of Ayacucho to sell her dry goods.  Ruth is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar.  Ruth’s dreams are to improve her businesses and be a good provider for her children.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena forma parte del Banco Comunal “Palatinas Al Progreso”, del distrito de Tarica, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 26 años de edad y dos hijos que viven junto a su conviviente que es obrero. Menciona que aún no tiene problemas difíciles y que afortunadamente todo está tranquilo. Considera haber tenido éxito en su vida personal porque actualmente está estudiando tejidos en el centro ocupacional de Monterrey en Huaraz. Su actividad económica en la actualidad es la venta de animales menores los cuales compra en este centro poblado y el Callejón de Huaylas y la venta de bebidas en el kiosco (lugar de venta transitoria) de su hermana donde a veces también expende chocho (comida típica de la región). Comenta que ha crecido regularmente porque empezó su negocio con S/.200 y ahora tiene invertido cerca de S/.1,800 en su negocio, tanto en la venta de animales menores como en la venta de bebidas y de chocho en el kiosco de su hermana.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de cuyes, gallinas y chancho para abastecerse y venderlos en Huaraz para las fiestas navideñas.
 
María Elena desea crecer y pronto tener su propio kiosco.
texts.en:
She is 26 years old and has 2 children and lives with her partner who is a construction worker. She feels successful on her personal life, because she is currently studying clothes at the occupational center of Monterrey en Huaraz. She sells small animals she buys in the town and she also sells beverages and food at her sister’s kiosk. She has grown regularly, she started her business with S/.200 and now she has about S/.1,800 invested on her business. With the loan of S/.1,000 which will be paid on 6 quotes, she will buy cuyes, chicken and pigs to increase her inventory trying to be ready for the holiday season. Maria Elena wants to grow and soon have her own kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cuyes,, chickens and pigs.
